4AqbqTd6dcVNuFmYqRJyNA.text: They offer one of the best Japanese tapas in town. The chicken skin skewer, pork belly, and the ones wrapped in bacon are all a must have! Their service does not disappoint either. Can't wait to come back!

Q-A7GpD00EnthGcKKjMXLg.text: Yup, I'm totally coming back here. Unbelievable prices and nice Japanese izakaya (bar-style) foods available, along with some more elegant fare and sushi.   Their menus had a lot of photos in them. Our table, when sat, was full of menus--they handed us 3 different menus to order from (see pics - pretty funny!) Sushi menu from Naked Fish, $2.80 & $3.80 izakaya menu, sakes and alcohol, a full regular food menu...I couldn't keep track of all of them!   The menus included a potato salad (Japanese potato salad is really good, and theirs was made with bleu cheese. I didn't order it, but my antennae are raised for the next time.) Karage, katsu, spring rolls, butter squid etc. typical iza food all found here.   It was dimly-lit, and while hard to see, I liked the feeling/look. They had individual shoji-screened rooms for intimate dinners in the other room, but we ate in the tiny main area of the restaurant. We ordered from every menu except the alcohol one:  -Baby ika (squid) with garlic and asparagus *on special* - SO DELICIOUS. I didn't want the little bowl to end. -Koro Koro steak. I don't eat beef but I made my friend eat it (I paid, so I got to call the shots haha!) He didn't have any feedback on it. I ate the bean sprouts underneath the steak. Really salty sauce; don't think I would order a chicken version of one if they offered it. -Agedashi tofu. One of my most favorite things to eat. I am keeping my tofu intake low these days, but it was both beautiful and delicious. Silken tofu with a soft-fried exterior, swimming in a soy broth...a staple for me. -Kyara popper. True story. When I asked the waiter what he liked that I should order, he recommended this: a crabmeat filled jalapeno. While spicy and good, I would not have ordered something like this here. This is the kind of fusion I can live without lol  -Kawa. Skewers of chicken skin! Aaah, it was like eating in Japan again! Fatty, fatty goodness. I was sad that I gobbled two, and considered ordering another one. -Sasami. Chicken tender skewer. This took the longest to prepare and I was surprised how big each skewer was. It was like they twisted an entire breast onto them!  -My buddy ordered a roll, but I can't remember what he ordered. I think he liked it? -Dessert (thanks, Yelp check-in!) was vanilla ice cream with a green tea sauce drizzled on it. I tried it and it was a nice way to close the meal.   My entire bill was $46. For two people. Ridic. Give these guys your business; you won't be disappointed!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at all the menus!!!
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Vanilla ice cream w/green tea sauce, view into the kitchen/counter seats.
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kawa (chicken skin), Kyara jalapeño crab poppers, Sasami (chicken breast) skewer.

hmkYsarUYEGUKJfA5e3w9w.text: Great lunch specials. Fish was very fresh, and most of the clientele were Japanese, which is the first thing I look for in my sushi places.   Get the bento lunch, $10 for a big meal!

4Vq6sCxdi0EPEkooWrbHnQ.text: tip: great alternative to Ichiza  Hamachi kama was the standard fare, kinda on the small side, nothing really special.  What's special is the soft shell crab.  Deep fried to perfection, can eat the entire thing shells and all, absolute must try.  Grilled whole squid was a bit of its guts inside it which was neither good or bad.  beef tongue was too thin and not seasoned enough, I've had better @ Yokohama in SD, chicken skin was nice and fatty, okra was not too charred which is simple and good, Hamachi carpaccio was okay.  tofu soup was a total ripoff.

IvrHmvNWZU_Lcmj10uPY6Q.text: Most interesting and entertaining establishment. You are greeted in and out quite vocally by the chefs and staff. The food was good, and the pricing was even better. Watching the chefs from the bar is a hoot!   Tried both sashimi and the fried dishes and most were really good, but not all that memorable. They did have Japanese Scotch, and that was a pleasant adventure.   Would I return? Yes, but not my first choice.

8ZO9oeHZBsKDx8CLrEHsLg.text: I just had dinner at Kayara and upon arriving home felt so compelled to writes review after my amazing dinner EXPERIENCE. I emphasize the experience part of it.  I love Ichiza. It's SO hard to get a table! And the wait? Forget it.   We were seated right away and the greeting when you come in is cute.  We received a large table which is awesome to not cram all of our food on a tiny table.  The restaurant is fairly new and well kept. Very clean and very modern. The stone chopstick holders are a nice touch. More refined than Ichiza. They have seats that are NOT the booth part which are small and kind of award. I'm short so no biggie, but the tall folk should sit on the booth part.   They give you a few menus including: a beverage menu, a sushi menu, a $2.80-3.80 menu, and their normal menu. The normal menu also includes a seasonal menu that changes each month which is on an insert of the menu on the first page. There is a big selection on their 2.80-3.80 menu just FYI.  Biggest love hate at Ichiza is? The items on paper covering the walls! Ordering is difficult!  WELL! HERE! They give you a pencil and paper to write which items you want that correlate with the menu. They're organized similarly so it's fairly easy to do. ALSO! Write any of the specials on the back of the paper!  Maybe it was slow, but our server, Mimi, was awesome. Not overly nice just so helpful. She actually filled out the order sheet for us, went through the pages of the menus one by one with us, and explained each dish we had questions about while giving us suggestions.   She even told us to check in on FB or Yelp so we each got a free dessert. And she asked for our names a the beginning of the meal and addressed us by them when we left.  When she brought our dishes to us she explained them to us, why certain garnishes came with them, explained how to eat the dishes with certain sauces, and always told us to enjoy.  Everything came out in a timely manner. Everything came out hot if it was meant to and cold if it was meant to.  Pet peeve alert: Usually at a restaurant you have a server and then some people help drop food off, but the people just drop stuff off and that's it. The staff here all checked on us, always smiled, brought us fresh hot tea and water many times. There was even a guy standing about 10 feet away in case we needed anything.  After getting our free dessert for checking in, paying, then leaving.. The host walks you out and holds the door while the staff yells something in Japanese I'm assuming means good night.  Overall it was just an awesome dining experience. The food was well priced, everything tasted good, everything was presented beautifully, the restaurant is beautiful, their staff is so nice. So in the end I definitely recommend Kayara. There were a lot of nice small touches that I just loved.   I'll just list some of the things we had with my favorites first.  FREE house tea. Hot, deep, delicious.   -Agedashi tofu and agedashi eggplant. Both are fried and served in a soy broth. I dream of this stuff! I first tried it at Ichiza and loved it. The version at Kayara is much better! There is a garnish of fresh ground ginger that really brightens the soy broth and it's also garnished with a fried shiseto pepper. (Two different dishes) I highly recommend these.  -Butter squid rings AND baby squid with asparagus. Soft squid rings sauteed in butter and seasoning. Addicting because the ikka was cooked perfectly. (Two different dishes)  -rice crackers with spicy tuna. Just a play on chips and dip. This was just average.  Soft shell crab appetizer. Tempura fried. This was perfectly cooked. Served with a lemon. Simple. Good.   Tuna Poke. This was good, but a bit salty. I enjoyed it, but not the best poke. I'd pass next time.   Skewers. We got eggplant, shiitake mushroom, and shiseto peppers. They are served with a sweet gingery sauce that was for the egg plant which came skinned.  Tomato caprese. This was a bed of thinly sliced avocado with sliced cherry tomatoes and chopped herb on top. A white cheese sauce was drizzled over. This was okay. All fresh ingredients, but one dimensional. My friend loved it though.  -pork belly on bean sprouts. I love pork belly. Any way! It was simple stir fried bean sprouts with three pieces of salted and peppered pork belly. Simple and yummy. Could have used some freshness, but pork belly is always good.  Shabu salad: this is grilled meat served on spinach. I LOVE SPINACH. Ichiza has a very good version, but I appreciate the use of spinach and the large portion of meat. The flavors were awesome. One of my favorites. Warning: some of the meat has a lot of fat, but that's a pro for me.   For dessert we got vanilla ice cream with a green tea reduction. It was nothing fancy, but it was delicious. Complete with cute wooden spoon.  We will def be back to try the famous green tea waffle and also the chocolate dessert.   I just spent an your writing this review. Go try the place!

However, when I did get my food, it was great! I immediately started eating, which is why I only have one picture. I had several different skewers, Yaki Onigiri, a Salmon Sashimi Bowl, and washed it down with peach sake. I even tried a bunch of other stuff the my friends had, and I would recommend all of it. Since it's tapas style, the price can add up, so be aware of how much you ordered. I have no problem recommending this restaurant to anyone. There is so much on the menu that I haven't tried, so I'm sure I'll be back.

Tux41l9XThPye17RKEDwIQ.text: I wanted small bites, so my friends suggested Kyara. It wasn't too long of a wait for a table of 6 on a Saturday night around 8:30pm. I assume this place is a lot busier during their happy hour, which would make coming here very worth while. Their food is pretty good. I ordered a few skewers, chicken gizzard my favorite! But it needed a bit more seasoning (salt did the trick) and it was a bit cold when it got to the table, which was a downside. Also order the beef intestine (sweeter seasoning and it was amazingly good) and yuzo chili salmon salad, pretty good. Decently priced, $9.50 might be a bit over the top for 5 slices of salmon though, but not by much. I wouldn't mind ordering it again. My friend order the salmon bowl which was a bigger bang for your buck. My grouped ordered takoyaki (6 pcs). I wanted to try their beef tongue, but I wasn't ready to splurge $8 on s skewer, but then we saw this beef tongue dish that was around the same price, but sadly forgot to order it and we were to full to get it when we realized. I found a new favorite drink from here called Peach calipico sour refreshing ($3.80) and bubbly. Their reggae punch is pretty good too. Refreshing, but no bubbles. It's been my second time here, I don't really remember the first time since I just ordered a cocktail. I'm glad I tried their food this time and every was friendly and service was good. Give them a try, you won't regret.

H6exk9-ar0Zl1rUUqfCAPg.text: I. Love. Kyara.  Now that I got that out of the way...  Kyara is the first Izakaya in Las Vegas that actually reminds me of a Japanese Izakaya. Everything small plates, and what they lack in size (although nothing is TOO small) they make up for in quality.  Great place to grab a late night bite, but their lunch menu is good too! The Berkshire pork is really good, the sizzling steak is good, every sushi roll I've had has been awesome, and the cheese corn!!!! don't even get me started on that wonderful dish.  Go. Stop reading this and order the cheese corn. Trust me on this one.

fN2MmFlodDb5i9OHhcHnqw.text: This is a great place for authentic Japanese food. The service was great and the food was very tasty! I ordered a katsu bento box as well as some soba noodles and was very satisfied. Good food portions for the price you pay (granted I'm from Seattle and sometimes the price for things is just not worth it). I'm in Vegas to visit family a lot so I will definitely come back here to try out more of their selections!

S2_kHN26sCUftL8ZutFYfA.text: This is one of my favorite lunch spot! Everytime I come here, I normally order the miso salmon combination. Everything on the combo is very delicious. It comes with shrimp and veggies tempura, miso soup, salad, rice, and the protein of your choice! The location is pretty easy to find but the restaurant is a little bit small.   But I have to warn you, the service is SUPER SLOW!! That's the one thing I don't like. I gave a 4 star for food but 3 star for service!  This place also have happy hour after 10pm so if you want $3 sake and some snacks to hang out, you can check out it at night as well...

drw_QPAYXfqGQYV98_vENA.text: Decided to hit up Kyara Japanese Tapas for lunch today, close to work and always good food. We were delighted to find they had reasonably priced lunch specials. I had only been here before for dinner.  My colleagues ordered the sushi and sashimi specials and I chose the Lisa Lisa roll and some salmon nigiri. If the Lisa Lisa sounds familiar to those of you who live in Las Vegas, it's because Kyara is a sister property of Naked Fish's on Durango.  The specials came out quickly which included a salad, soup, shrimp and veggie tempura and a bowl of rice. The nigiri variety and sashimi came out after a bit and my colleagues both said they would definitely come back again. The Lisa Lisa was good. Shrimp tempura with avocado and cream cheese topped with crunch and eel sauce. The salmon nigiri was fresh and tasted good with the hidden dab of wasabi under it.  To sum up, was a good meal had by all and we will be back. Arigatogozaimashita, Totemo

Ql1CrJxLDNohSR_F0rqCMQ.text: This is probably one of the worst reviews Ive done.  I probably wont come back again.    Let me start with the food.  The food is okay, personally the kimchi was probably my favorite.  We got the Mini Stamina Don (Pork Belly with garlic on rice), Yellowtail Jalapeno, Kimchi, Chutoro Sashimi, Salmon Belly Sashimi, Ika Gueso, Beef Tongue, and Miso Soup.  I had the don, beef tongue, and kimchi.  The beef tongue was good but the pork belly was alright.    Now for service, it was terrible.  There wasnt much people even here and everything took forever.  We got the Miso soup last because our server forgot about it.  We waited literally an hour for it and for the rest probably 45 minutes. The table next to us ordered as we were waiting but got their food right away which I dont understand how and why. Probably because one of the girls was a coworker.  They got great service and our server was attentive to them.  I also didnt know that employees could drink alcohol while working.  Maybe thats why we got lame service.  The table next to us was also very obnoxious.  They kept yelling for the server because they were so drunk.    I honestly wont be returning to this place because it just sucks.  I had high expectations and wanted to rate it high as possible but service is a big thing to me.  I used to be a server & I understand if it was busy but there was barely any tables.

kNeGl7rV5nvgeGI12VqeQw.text: With the sudden and sad departure of SHIN Yakitori House in the Spring Valley area, Kyara comes as a welcome addition in this neighborhood.  Call it a cross between Ichiza and Raku, this town has plenty of room for another izakaya type of establishment and many hungry customers waiting in the wings.  Kyara is located in an unassuming and relatively quiet area along Jones and Sunset next to a Tropical Smoothie Cafe.  The mood is set when you enter what feels like a upscale restaurant.  Chaos is not what this place is about.  There are plenty of counter seats where you can watch the kitchen in action, but with the Baby in tow, we sat at a table. The restaurant is set up in sections making private parties a great possibility.  Once we were seated, there was a slight lapse where we thought we had been forgotten. Instead, they were deep frying a fresh taste of their mountain potato to get your taste buds working.  The menu is easily broken up with their daily specials being the star. It's very much a revolving menu as items available two months ago aren't offered now.  Our dinner items:  * Deep fried Yamaimo - This mountain potato was lightly fried with a sprinkling of furikake.  The delicate flavor surprisingly impressed us and had us wanting more of this complimentary offering.  As someone asked, was it gooey...and not at all!  * Yuzu Chili Salmon Salad ($7.50) - Five slices of salmon along with greens makes this a tasty dish.  Assembled quite simply but satisfyingly.  * Albacore Jalapeno ($7.50) - Seven slices of albacore that had a sauce that we enjoyed.  * Spicy Tuna Dip ($5) - A generous ball of spicy tuna alongside crispy rice crackers.  We spread the tuna onto the cracker and enjoyed the crunch along with the spice.  * Agedashi Tofu ($4.30) - Good, but not quite my favorite although I still enjoyed it.  * Negi Ma ($1.90) - The chicken and green onion we chose to have sauce on it, our mistake.  Skip the sauce next time.  * Enoki Bacon ($2.30) - Anything wrapped in bacon tastes good!  * Kawa ($2.20) - Grilled chicken skin...a dash of salt and togorashi is all you need.  * Butabara ($2.20) The pork belly was a rather disappointing since it was dried out and not fatty enough for me.   * Daikon Salad ($4.20) - I'm not usually a fan of daikon salad but the simple additions to their version makes it a nice and subtle dish.  * Gyutan ($5.50) - The beef tongue was good, but not as tender as I would have hoped.  * Kaisen Chawanmushi ($5) - Their version of a steamed custard was the real winner of the night.  It was super super smooth and luxurious and probably among the best chawanmushis I have ever experienced.  It also came with a decent amount of seafood inside and the Husband and I were both thoroughly impressed.  Worth getting your own and not sharing.  * Koro Steak ($9.50) - We were told it was quite tender and that is the very truth.  We both loved the steak, but could have done without the beansprouts...something else would have been better.  * Soft Shell Crab Appetizer ($5.80) - My only real complaint was that it lacked something...a dipping sauce of maybe ponzu, tempura sauce, or Japanese mayo would have been nice.  But then again, maybe that's how I usually get it elsewhere and that's how I'm used to having it.  * Tofu Mousse ($4.80) "Homemade Vanilla Tofu Mousse" - We're all about homemade tofu and definitely wanted to try their sweet version.  It was accompanied by a raspberry(?) sorbet-like granita that could have been broken down a bit more.  It arrived in chunks that made it   difficult to get into with the wooden spoons provided.  Nonetheless, we still enjoyed this sweet ending to our dinner.    Overall, it was a lovely Mother's Day dinner.  Service was polite and what you would expect from a real Japanese restaurant.  We were impressed by the number of Japanese diners there along with the families as well.  It brings a different ambiance and we liked it.  There are a few things that are a bit more costly than what I'd expect, so be prepared.  We'll be going back again to see what other specials come up!  * * Update! We returned on 06.24.  Additional items we tried included:  * Beef Tataki ($9.50) -   * Homemade Tofu ($4.80) - We love the simplicity of homemade tofu.  Here it is accompanied with wasabi, bonito shavings, finely grated ginger, and scallions.  * Tofu Miso Kushi ($1.50) - Three pieces on a skewer, grilled with some miso sauce.  Simple and tasty.  * Wakasagi Age "Deep Fried Surf Smelt" ($4.50)   * Ayu Shio Yaki "Grilled seasonal sweet fish from Japan" ($9.50)   * Hirame Carpaccio "Halibut - South Korea" ($6.50)  * Gyu Shabu Salad "Sliced Beef & Spinach" ($6.50)  * Chocolate Fondant "Homemade Chocolate Fondant with Vanilla Ice Cream" ($6.50)  We were offered a different complimentary taster, but we craved the deep fried yamaimo.  They were nice enough to fry us up a batch!  Love it! Dessert was free because it was the Husband's birthday!   4.5 stars from 4 stars!

UPUeBdfYFr-RQ39XCmtBiA.text: They took 50 minutes to get my order out (very simple roll). All of my friends finished their food as we periodically asked the server for my order. I had to get it to go and practically beg them to put it on the house for the inconvenience. I think management needs some lessons in MIR (Make it right).

O1C1zZ2Lso5KtFcz7W5rxg.text: This is quite possibly my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  My man and I come here often for both lunch and dinner.  Our most recent meal was for Valentine's Day and we were greeted with complimentary champagne.  When we ordered a bottle of wine (Wolfgang Puck Chardonnay, excellent and only $30!) our server displayed it in the chiller with baby's breath and wrapped in red linen, so cute and festive!  The lunch combos are great and very good value, but the dinner is what keeps us coming back.  The plates are great for sharing and small enough that we can get lots of variety.  We usually get around 10 or so different items.  Having worked our way through almost everything on the menu by now, we still have not found a single dish here we didn't like.  Make sure you save room at the end for the green tea mochi ice cream.  The contrast between the cold smooth ice cream and the chewy gelatinous mochi is amazing and a light but satisfying end to the meal.  Sitting up at the bar gives a great view into the kitchen and the chef will often come by and talk to us about the dishes.  This is especially beneficial if you are an adventurous eater like I am (chef has teased us about being the only non-Asian people to order some of the more out there options).  The February specials include live scallops so fresh the chef said it was still wiggling when he sliced it.  Also try anything with Ika (raw squid).  The texture and flavor are fantastic.  This place really is authentic Japanese cuisine.  We will definitely be back again and again.

pj5U6fb-QkURN7SgA7Q7QA.text: Love this place!! Get the GTR roll...chicken skins...pork belly soup...and the best oyster shooters I have ever had!! The service is always a A+!! Will always be back :)

vy0RI-V37uFb0AErD5PARw.text: Without ever having been to Ichiza or Raku I can't say where Kyara fits in the hierarchy of Las Vegas izakayas. But, I can tell you that I'm a fan. Not only is the food delicious, but the layout of the restaurant is inviting yet intimate, with it's small, separate dining areas surrounding its open kitchen. The look of the place is that of a modern japanese motif without being heavyhanded and over-adorned with unnecessary flair.  But, what you really want to hear about is the food, right? Here are the hits and misses that we ordered:  HITS: + Maguro carpaccio ($7.50) - brilliant, brightly colored tuna, thinly sliced. Wonderful flavors. So good we had a second order. Loved the garlic chips atop each slice of fish. + Albacore with jalapeno ($7.50) - delicious, fresh. Another dish we had to order seconds of. + Veggie spring rolls ($2.50) - light, crispy, not the largest spring rolls, but delicious nontheless + Veggie tempura mix ($4.50) + Cheese tempura ($6.50) - three slices of fairly mild cheeses (mozzarella, havarti, brie) accompanied by a fig jam. I liked it but it's a difficult dish to share if you want to split each piece of cheese.  Misses:  - Spicy tuna dip with rice crackers ($5) - not my favorite. I wasn't a fan of the paste-like texture of the tuna and it had little heat to it. - Pork belly ($2.20) - 3 per skewer. They were ok, but after having the pork belly at Sushi House Goyemon a couple days earlier I was disappointed. The biggest turnoff was the tiny bits of cartilage in two of the pieces of pork.  I thought everything was reasonably priced. Expect to pay anywhere from $20-40 per person depending on how hungry you are. And, they have some good wines by the glass for around $5. That's tough to beat in this town. Good food + good prices = I'll be back often.

Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic potato ($3.50) - deep fried potato with garlic butter
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus ($1.50)

wjkeqCumzhxj2u8U7SpTOg.text: Just a little teaser for our first visit but enough to get us back to try more!  We went 10pm and I am trying to be good so wasn't looking to eat everything like I normally would :)  I had to try the Yuzu chili salmon salad as I saw so many great reviews on it so will definitely come back for that, so yummy!  However not a fan of the aji tataki, too fishy and too much ginger for me.  I wanted to try it since in the happy hour menu and thought it would me like a tuna tartar.  Had the shrimp tempura with spicy tuna and albacore on top which was good.  deja Vu will be our next try.  Hubby enjoyed the pork fried rice and butter corn.  It's a cute place and the wide menu variety is great so will be back to try more on a cheat day :)  The only thing that was a little off was the waiter didn't come to check on us, so had to flag him down to place another order, order dessert and then for the check so that could have been better, even just one time.  Everyone else came by a lot though to fill our water and take our finished plates.  Overall, good food, fun options and it's closeby, so I forsee us being back as regulars.

gK0-NmZwn8-gd8NpQMnB1Q.text: Kyara was decent, but definitely didn't live up to the hype. I can't stand Ichiza so it is nice to know there's another good alternative when Raku is full.   Food was nothing special, the things I can remember having are the garlic potatoes, grilled squid, yuzu chili salmon, soft shell crab, enoki mushrooms w/ bacon, chicken skin, pork belly skewers, chicken skewers, some beef bowl, and some sashimi. The only things that stood out were the yuzu chili salmon and pork belly - everything else was pretty forgettable. Their lychee chu cocktail of lychee syrup, shochu and soda was really good and under $5. Perfect light summer cocktail.    Food came out at a really odd pace, skewers took 15-20 min even though kitchen seemed adequately staffed and the place wasn't full. Just an overall mediocre experience for $30/person. I may come back for lunch, but I'll stick to Raku for this type of food. Similar pricing but Raku does the same thing so much better.    I'd also recommend getting the skewers with salt, not sauce - get some on the side if anything so it's not drowned in teri sauce.

bKHdwgpRBIfvAuPRmfq6sA.text: Ok, ok ... so a few months ago I came and I was pissed with this place because they didn't have coke, but guess what. Now they do so i'm a happy camper. Sometimes its the little things that matter and make your dining experience better.    No more waiting at the door.  It seems they now acknowledge everybody that walks through the door and will immediately seat you.  I've been a regular ever since. Great  lunch specials, and in my opinion best tempura in town.  Did i mention great lunch specials?  Very filing Soup, Salad, Rice, tempura and Sashimi. Perfect. Since i've become a regular, I love the fact that I walk in and they know exactly what I'm going to have. Friendly service, and quick check out process. I've only been here for lunch so I don't know what dinner is like but I'll try it when I work late one night.  Thank you for making my lunch experience so amazing.

oGT8jk4xGiKtMnjdzgQf0Q.text: Love this local spot. I come here whenever there is a special event or I am craving some real Japanese cuisine. Not that "Japanese-American" AYCE food.

sb4AjkurjK2SXe51dNr0zA.text: Good food nice atmosphere good service. Highlights are the tempura cheese yumm, DeJa Vu roll yumm, salmon arugula salad yumm, corn on cob glazed yumm.  Lowlights were jumbo oyster was too big and fishy smell n taste, spicy tuna and chips were bland, needed a drizzle of something over to add flavor.  Great meal we will be back!

3e4oo9KCgJML4e-6q5YNDw.text: So where do you do when Sierra Gold's kitchen is closed for no reason? Obviously Kyara cause Japanese tapas area perfect substitute... Ok yeah we went cause it was right next door and open at 12am.  Usually I am not a big fan of tapas restaurants... All to often 'tapas' turns out to be a restaurant's excuse to offer up small portions of food at full price, and while Kyara wasn't exactly an exception to this, it was definitely worth it.  Kyara is a pretty good alternative to the long wait times at Ichiza or if you can't get a table at Raku. The restaurant is kinda like a Japanese Firefly and so far without the Salmonella poisoning which is a definite plus! Some of the dishes worth checking out: are the mochi bacon skewers, cheesy tomato potato, and the pork skewers.  The food was great but a little over-priced. At about $4 per skewer and $8 for a larger dish you can easily drop $30 bucks here and still be able to eat more, but then again, I don't think you get these dishes anywhere else in town.  The service was kinda of slow but the servers were so polite it almost made up for it. Yes I am being generous with the 4 stars but they get props for offering a yelp check-in offer! Vanilla ice cream with green tea paste yummm.

t2-83rGV2kOmJFygSo3IpQ.text: Love, love, love this place! The food, albeit a little pricey, is amazingly good. The uni and wagyu are amazing but you really can't go wrong with anything here. Try to make it for happy hour if you can (after 10pm I think) for some better deals.

C8KxbLVdJ6R6TzcWLAcp0Q.text: Visited Kyara on a Saturday night. Usually I had to wait long time to get seated; however, we were seated right away this time.We ordered plum wine (choya), pork kimchi, ika butter, pork fried rice, and ramen. I have been there for more than 10 times, but the consistency of the food is absent most of the times. The noodles for the ramen tasted bad and kind of puffy. Some servers are friendly and attentive. Some need more training on customer service. I would rate Kyara better than Ichiza, but I still do think they have room for improvement in order to satisfy more customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plum wine

FZw91LyaFds4aJvQTcDsNA.text: This place is an authentic excellent Japanese izakaya.  The foods are fantastic. It's at the same level as what I can have in Tokyo. Every food tastes perfect. I'll come back again when I go down to Las Vegas next time.

o4jrGebTek1hZ-55SNhCXw.text: Came here twice but it is nothing special. I mean I will probably come back because its close to my house and closes late, but i oftentimes forget its even there.

sT-KFD8EbvyZ6P71cujQ3w.text: I would give them 5 star solid, but they didn't refill our water til the end of our meal which is like 30 minutes after we got there. and they forgot our KORO KORO STEAK which was a real bummer cause it was not simmering at all when we got in on the table.  other than that, oh my ~ the food was freaking bomb. i mean not trying to talk all bad about FIREFLY restaurant or anything. but KYARA was like ten times freaking much better ! its a must go since i had like the best FOODGASM (; heheh.   a must try : enoki pork, mackerel sashimi, & vanilla ice cream with green tea sauce. that was my top 3. oh and i left out the bomb mushroom covered with bacon skewer.  get this though . FIREFLY is probably like $$$ and KYARA compared to their prices is $ .. idk, me and my boyfriend got full by just spending $30 .. in food.   definitely gonna recommend this place (: I am a totally satisfied customer (food wise) .. service wise. it was okay.

fHb4QV-23y7dxgJz4VQ31A.text: Little closed off sections makes Kyara feel very intimate. When you walk in,  you see the restaurant is not that big. The stools are surprisingly comfortable. I normally dart to the booth if possible, but I was too slow, but I wasn't hurting like I normally would when sitting on a seat without back support.   Three of us came in at 11pm on a Friday and was surprised by how slow it was. By midnight, it was beginning to fill out. The service was speedy and friendly without being intrusive.   We had ordered the mini udon, the perfect single portion with a few slices of fish cakes and seaweed. The broth was light and refreshing. The garlic potatoes were thrown in a thin breading and came out crispy. We also got tofu and beef. The broth for the dish was sweet, the meat is similar to bulgogi, and the tofu picked up both flavors well. Make sure to check what the daily specials are because if they have the homemade tofu, it is a must. With the consistency and slight sweetness, it is reminiscent of a panacotta. It was creamy and rich without being over decadent. Paired with the scallions, grated ginger, wasabi, and benito shavings it was more of a savory appetizer, but when eaten alone it could pass off as a dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Homemade tofu

r_S4gP1aYOLqwimEKQNgmA.text: Kyara is dope! Kyara was totally worth driving to if you're staying on the strip and have a rental car like we did. It's izakaya style food (bar food) so you know the portions are good and the prices are legit. The staff here are awesome. Super friendly and they all yell Japanese bar greetings at you when you enter and do the same as a fair well when you leave. It's a pretty cool touch.  The interior is all wood and super chic looking; very classy. The menu is well laid out and easy enough to figure out even if you have no idea what you're looking at (as was the case with me).  I had chicken tender skewers which were cooked and seasoned perfectly. They pulled right off the skewer with a minimum amount of effort. They weren't dry or chewy at all. I also had the koro beef which was fantastic. The beef was so tender and juicy. I seriously was not expecting it to be THAT good. I followed it up with the Sunset Roll which is spicy tuna inside the roll with albacore on top of the roll. It was made with skill and both fish tasted great. It's definitely a step above a lot of sushi rolls I've had elsewhere. One of my biggest sushi pet peeves is when they're made in a rush and fall apart when you try to pick them up with your chopsticks so you can actually, ya know, eat them. This was not a problem here at all! I ended the meal with my complimentary vanilla ice cream with green tea syrup (check in on Yelp for this tasty Yelp Deal). It was refreshing and tasty. The green tea syrup was the perfect addition to a decent scoop of vanilla ice cream. Really, I think vanilla is such a good flavor when trying to showcase a more subtle flavor like green tea or lavender. If you come to Vegas and love Japanese or Asian style cuisine and want some food prepared by skilled chefs for a great price then Kyara is your spot. It's worth every penny and every second of the round trip there and back to the strip.  I'm a fan!

Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tender skewer.
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Koro beef.

y8VBBqCmK-ceNb9eq87Eew.text: I was just here and waited for 10minutes without being greeted by a single server/host despite every floor server making at least one eye contact with our group i decided to ask if all the tables are occupied and one person just nods and goes back to what he was  doing behind the cash register i dont care if this place serves the best food in the universe these  people need to get the stick out of their behinds

8hLFjdwekIx3ysBZNAXA9w.text: I came for dinner after a long day working inside the jail-like datacenter nearby. I was totally opt for some relaxation which the  was perfect!  Kyara has a great collection of sake and recommendation in the menu. The skewers are perfectly match for any sake!  If you are looking for the relaxation, this place is perfect.  I came on during the week night so I'm not sure how busy it would be on weekends.

J98uxCKXbi4AxDZ2VVMLkw.text: Came here to meet up with a couple of friends for lunch and we were the only ones in the entire restaurant. We were seated in the front left section and for some odd reason it felt like a sauna so we decided to move to a different section. Regardless of the section we sat in it was still hot. Also, it was a bit difficult to get our waiter to come stop by the table. We constantly had to keep stopping the waiter from walking away from our table to refill drinks.   We decided to order the beef teriyaki combination (miso soup, salad, and tempura shrimp/vegetables) and the Lisa Lisa roll. All of our food was delicious and cooked perfectly. So despite the service and the heat, the food is DEFINITELY WORTH IT.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef teriyaki
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lisa Lisa roll

K20V-kry9u5rtpyvq7fYew.text: I have visited Kyara several times since my initial review and just felt like it needed an update. Kyara is still "As good as it gets!" for me. The food and service are still as stellar as when I first visited. I have dined here sober a couple of times, and can say that I like the food just as good sober as when I am inebriated. So it is not just the affect of alcohol on my hypothalamus making me more responsive to the aromas, although I do not mind that at all.  Great food and service with a pleasant environment keeps me coming back to Kyara and makes it the Izakaya restaurant I compare all other restaurants in this genre to.

3Gcr04BreNLddGYoCHh4_g.text: Really disappointed in the service at the restaurant. My boyfriend and I have been craving Japanese tapas since we came back from Tokyo and this place looked great based on reviews. Wow were we wrong, I'm appalled by the service at Kyara.   We sat down and ordered our food, waited for 30 min and all that we got was miso soup. After waiting more they brought us half of our food. I noticed that we were the only  table that was given cheap wooden takeout chopsticks, after asking for the kind of chopsticks that the rest of tables had because they were better quality and not so flimsy, the waitress just brought me another pair of cheap ones. So we had to ask again!    Now our miso soup is supposed to come with rice which they forgot, so I asked for the rice we ordered and the waitress looked at me like I was crazy and only brought me one rice even though I asked for two for the second time.   So since we only got half of our meal and our rice came very late we still were trying to stay positive because the food did taste great. Unfortunately, this was not the last of our problems. So we waited and waited and waited for the rest of our food to come out and no one even came to check up on us until I had to flag someone down. I asked if the rest of our food was coming and the waiter looked confused. Yeah apparently they just forgot. Wow that was the last straw, I am a very patient and understanding person and I was very upset with the way my boyfriend and I were treated here.   The cherry on top was that it was not even busy and the other table next to us who came in after us got all of their food and were happy as clams.   I do not recommend this place to anyone.

TcNi9-kqK9lYJF3sXLqTpQ.text: The best 4 star place I know of, Kyara has a plethora of great items...really, really great items!  What they are: One of the best options in town for Japanese Tapas / Izakaya.  What they aren't: The best sushi spot in the southwest A high-end Izakaya joint...although the value you get here is something special!  My favorites include: Yuzu Chili Salmon w/ Arugula Cabbage Ra-Yu--this is one of the tastiest raw cabbage dishes I've encountered! Inaniwa Udon Healthy Kushi Mori (Bonus tip--we always keep the Ra-Yu oil left over from the cabbage and used it to dress these veggies.)  I always make a point to check out their monthly specials as many of these items have been quite good.  They recently had a Tomato Nabe that was UNBELIEVABLY GOOD!  Another of my favorites was a Stuffed Shishito Pepper they were doing for a while.  Lots of friends are really into their lunch specials, but I don't ever make it in for lunch.  I am all about their small plates and skewers!   I wouldn't argue with anyone that wanted to give Kyara 5 stars.  I just think that they are not as good as it gets on multiple items that they serve.  In closing, please note that Japan has over 50,000 people who are over 100years old...widespread debate abounds as to the reason why.  Most assume that it is due to the use of toilet slippers to keep the rest of the house clean. Others point to Kancho on the playground, KFC on Christmas Eve, Yaeba, or Inemuri.  I have scientifically eliminated these ideas and narrowed it down to two possibilities: Soine-ya & Hadaka Matsuri.  I'll let you come up with your own conclusion though.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Onsen Tamago ...from the monthly special menu.

cWnpq_6gHbYaTWvBBqmcrg.text: One of the greatest happy hour menus. I looooove coming here just to get drunk tbh. There are so many different types of drinks you can get on happy hour for very cheap. Also the food is great especially the skewers- try the salted butabara. The service is always amazing. The servers are very attentive!!! It always very clean here too. If you and your friends cant decide where to eat at 10 pm come here!!!! You wont regret it

lw56p44YC7EVDLM_MDS9nw.text: This place just needs to be larger. I spent an excruciating 2 hours at dinner next to the most annoying, ungrateful girl that epitomizes everything that is wrong with our youth. Can you dock a restaurant for that? Yes! Because it wasn't big enough for me to move away from her. Even the people next to us stood outside with their food.   On to the food! This was solid. Everything on a stick was tasty - pork cheek, pork belly, chicken thigh, mushrooms, shishito peppers, ground chicken/pork. The jalapeno albacore was okay. The sushi roll was above average, but my boyfriend did eat sushi which is a small miracle in itself. Butter shrimp rice was very buttery. I loved the ponzu chicken!  Overall, I enjoyed the food!

nIy1mmrE7HYuXBVG8gIzjw.text: new favorite place!!!! Service was great, selection great. Happy hour oh yeah. It is a bit cozy inside and you will leave smelling like grilled food. Good prices and if you are looking for portion control it's a great place.

Yz2L52xzIruKQUX2QvFBnQ.text: I would give this place a 3.5 stars . Probably because I've had Raku's izakaya and it was better .   The skewers could have been bigger and meatier. Some were a little over cooked :/   The garlic shrimp , kimchee pork, agedashi tofu , shitaki mushrooms , and the whole squid plate were my favorites .   Less than stellar - WSOP (smallest sushi roll I've ever had and very little fish), enoki mushroom , beef intestine skewer , salmon skin bowl , asparagus bacon , salmon sashimi bowl (tasted fishy) .   It takes a lot to get full with the small orders . So you end up spending a lot and it's too bad they weren't better .

b_fK7NnIJ9plqD__8Ms4MA.text: This place has the most amazing lunch special! It's a little far out from the strip but it's nice to see normal suburban Vegas. The salmon lunch is probably the best in my opinion.

Zeu3W5rI5rd4rT6GzYx39A.text: Yummy! This place was absolutely delicious!   There was a 30 minute wait or so but we didn't mind. Once seated we ordered an abundance of tapas to share: pork belly skewers, kimchi pork, tuna poke, udon noodle, enoki bacon skewers, soft shell deep fried crab, baby squid with garlic, yellowtail collar, and ended with vanilla ice cream topped with green tea syrup.  The tapas were amazing. I really liked the kimchi pork (pork stir fried with kimchi) and probably could have ate another whole dish myself. I also really liked the baby squid (stir fried with asparagus and garlic, came with asparagus and had a blast of garlic flavor) and the hamachi collar (flaked in your mouth and came with a tangy ponzu sauce).  The service was good and our server was nice. The food came out very slowly and spread out. Our udon didn't come out until a hour later. At one point we were wondering if the udon was even going to come out...  If you check into Kyara on yelp, it tells you that you get a free appetizer. I showed our server the yelp offer and he said they no longer offered a free appetizer, but a free cocktail or dessert instead. We didn't mind and used it for the ice cream at the end of our meal. They definitely should update their offer!  Kyara has excellent Japanese tapas. The tapas did come out slow but the taste of the food outweighed our wait time. I left very satisfied and full. I came home and told my roommate about how good it was... I'll have to bring her next time!

0PBoNvXxoIFPdX0kBKKn7A.text: Been coming here forever since they opened, service has always been great, the food you just can't ever get enough of,  too many choices for me to say which is my fave, but yes 10/10 come again once every week

y6_vmpXP43fX3eG-wjB7eg.text: The jalapeno poppers were delicious. Really spicy. Don't eat then somen unless you like slimey potato lol. The agedashi tofu was really tasty. The sashimi was fresh. The buttered squid was okay. The rice balls with salmon was filling but go with the special sauce tuna instead

R8yjXGO4B1Xo1ViC3hzTLg.text: This is a great place for tapas!!! I usually go here with my friends for their late night happy hour which starts at 10 and there are great deals on their sake, cocktail drinks, and some of their tapas. All of their skewers are good especially their chicken skin skewer if you're into something like that. All of the waiters and waitresses are always so nice when I come, I love this place!

xuk3PQTI11gKJ0sJo730lw.text: Had some friends from out if town who wanted Japanese. Was looking for a late night spot and thought about this place. I had heard tons of great things about this place so was excited to try this place out. Sadly, as soon as we got there we realized it's not really a place for a group of people, we were only a group of 6. The restaurant is small, so after about 40 min we were sat. We got there in time for happy hour so we were actually able to try a lot of dishes.    Must trys: Yellowtail with jalapeno Tuna sashimi bowl Octopus dumplings (not the name on menu) Fried squid Mackarel sashimi salad  The salmon sashimi was really good and fresh!   Another thing that makes this place different is the variety of flavors they have for edamame! Definitely try the garlic butter, DELICIOUS!!  Service was pretty good,no real complaints. I'm not against going back again but probably wouldn't go with a group of people.

RxEbonWn9v4lDLMpvXP5eg.text: Okay, this is some legit Izakaya. Great taste and value. All of the skewers, the eel roll, the fried jalapeno and fried cheese sides, tempura, everything was just great. Skip the strip and just get the good stuff here.

Yb8UsTc9DYo_XgD2I3deLg.text: I have been coming here for years. I had the first date with the love of my life here and it has always been a special place in both of our hearts. We dined here tonight and I had go up to the server more than 3 times to ask for water and I had to order food at the bar (since our server was no where to be found) which is very disappointing. I hope they get this place together soon because I love this place. The food was awesome, but the service seriously needs help. We had a horrible experience. We want to keep coming here, so please fix this.

iBIMSjVs-S0vsNLbtnX5fA.text: Kyara always offers the best japanese tapa options and service! Ask for Brian, he will take care of all your needs!

FvEc7heyIRLKyJNgRLSZpg.text: Great kushi shop for late night eats. A bit expensive, but you definitely can't go wrong getting some chicken nankotsu.

WoHrYbaqtiUiF7SsV_3SGw.text: They have a really interesting menu, lot's of choices and food is fresh. There is also nice selection of sake. Had a good time. Menu is a bit on the pricey side.

9grR7h_0l7SDuoSmlMwzGQ.text: The food and decor was very good. The lunch specials are a steal! The only reason I knocked off one star was because the initial guy that seated us. This place is a sister restaurant to naked fish, so I expected their service to be at the same level as them (which is fabulous). However when we first walked in, the guy that saw us didn't look too happy, frowned, and barked "how many." He looked like he hated it there. All the other encounters with the others were fine but nothing extraordinary like at naked fish. But I would recommend this place to others! Food is good and fresh!

GUq8iJm4mNcMCsRVdJEGiA.text: Another hidden gem of Las Vegas!  A perfect reason as to why you should rent a car and explore the delicious foods off of the Vegas Strip.  While Kyara may not be as easily accessible (a little hard to find) or celebrated as other izakaya places in Vegas, it is easily one of my top places to eat in Vegas, finishing BARELY behind Raku.  Kyara is an experience that you must try.  So on to the story.  I visited Las Vegas in March 2012 to play in an ice hockey tournament with my team/friends.  For some reason, I am the designated food person so after some calling around (it being almost 11pm by the time we had finished a game, showered and gotten ready), we decided on Kyara because, a) it was on my list of place to try, b) it was open late, and c) it could accommodate our large group of 15+.  Once at the restaurant, I had some skeptics, but once we ordered the food and ate in silence for the first 10 or so mins, the "ooohhs" and "aaahhs" and "oh-my-effin-g that's good" started blurting out.   Highlights of the menu that received extra orgasmic sounds of appreciation:  Maguro Carupaccio Hamachi Jalapeno (must order!) Age dashi Mochi Kaisen Chawanmushi (extra drool factor) Pork Kimchee Koro Koro Steak Butabara Skewer Gyutan Skewer (beef tongue is really good, you need to try it once) Enoki Bacon (extra drool factor)  So as you can tell, that is a crap load of food so I highly recommend to bring a group (at least four) and an appetite.    Another Vegas exploration success!

XNhn1rtONerfevK2GysNOQ.text: The tapas are delicious and the service is good. I've gone there twice and have had good consistent service and quality food.

yWt2-ib9qcxiaCaxA5GV1Q.text: This is one of my favorite Japanese restaurants. I've never been disappointed with anything that I order. One of my favorites, since I love seafood is Ika Maru. It's crazy that every time I'm here, I always have this dish. The servers are very attentive, too.

nIOTK1UcFUD1LR81hB2SQw.text: LOVE, LOVE, LOVE this place!! I only go to Kyara at night because of their tapas. I haven't been there for lunch yet so I'm not sure if lunch is just as good as their dinner. First timers you should definitely get the egg custard w/ seafood, the yuzu chili salmon salad, magaru carupaccio, ika butter, kyara poppers, and the niku tofu. You won't be disappointed! Oh and for dessert the chocolate fondant is delicious!  The staff is so nice and their service is great! =]

mLduTcKjE-jOshs78Ry1Zg.text: Wow, what a great Japanese Restaurant.  I think Raku and Kyara have separated themselves as the two best Japanese Restaurants outside of the strip.    Many dishes are very traditional, but they have a creative flare to some of their modern dishes.  The pork belly, gobo nabe special was out of this world good.  We always love the spicy tuna w/rice crackers.    Don't go into Kyara expecting sushi, this is not a sushi bar.  They might have sushi or sashimi as a daily special.    ***Definitely hit them up for lunch.  Best meal under $10 in town.  (I had the grilled saba w/salad, miso soup, rice, and shrimp & mixed veg tempura.)

btOf0bbyP1KgbSS1Yxam1A.text: Beautiful and tranquil ambiance with good food.  On a Sunday evening I came in for dinner with a friend.  My friend, who is Asian, made this statement:  "You know this place is good, look at all the Asians eating here."  While said in jest, she turned out to be spot on, because most everything we ate was delicious.   The decor is peaceful and clean in a minimalist fashion without being silly, featuring muted tones of bamboo, lots of straight lines, and an airy layout.    Since this is a tapas-style restaurant, it's best to order a whole bunch of stuff, and share like you're in Kindergarten.....and you're not selfish with the blocks and firetruck.    Here are some highlights of our meal:  Yellowtail w/ jalapeno and ponzu - This preparation is very common at Japanese restaurants lately, but that doesn't mean it isn't wonderful.  They finish the yellowtail sashimi off with a cilantro leaf, dash of Sriraucha, paper-thin jalapeno, and citrusy ponzu sauce.  Mmm-mmm good!  Spicy Tuna w/ rice crackers - The Crackers are really more like Japanese rice cakes, the healthy crunchy kind.  I thought the spicy tuna was light and tasty, but the rice cracker was too big and took away from the fish.  Still a good dish.   Agedashi - A perfectly flash-fried tofu in light soy broth w/ shredded daikon radish and other yummy accouterments.  Really, really good.    Chicken/Pork sausage skewer - This had a name although it escapes me.  It should be called stick-0-delish, because it was smoky, crispy, and wonderful.    Everything was spot on, from the food to the service.  I will definitely come back to get my dinner on soon.   ***Side note:  Apparently they have mouth wash in the girls bathroom.......so there's that.

Zaz8iyvh6JMbyXAiJY1FVQ.text: This place has received so many good reviews I just have to assume I either came on an off night or ordered all the wrong things.  However, nothing I ate stood out and a few of the items were mediocre.  After having a few small plates, I was still hungry so I ordered the koro koro steak.  It didn't have a great sear on it and the flavor wasn't very pleasant.  I left most on the plate and ended up snacking later when I got home.

0rMkirCethy944lZ-n5Hrw.text: Great friendly staff that always remember a returning guest.  The food is always more than satisfying and never a let down.  The Yaki Onigiri is a must have and one of my many favorites.

vZJm-q2X4yvXY3fclA3mQA.text: Really!!! Surprisingly fantastic and fun. Reasonably priced. The spicy tuna dip, gobo chips, garlic chicken w rice, edamame, bacon wrapped asparagus, chicken rice bowl, sushi sashimi bowl... All delicious!!! Easy to share and great intimate environment. OH! And they make a delicious homemade saki sangria in a mason jar! Give it a try!

3Pupg3-xomzXB9gCdZU7qw.text: The best place to get authentic Japanese food and service in town! After going there once I was absolutely sold. Doesn't matter what item on the menu you get, it's all so good. Someone checks up on you to make sure you got everything you need. I tell all my friends to try this place because it's so amazing. This is my absolute favorite place to eat!

-N2dxRqiY1tiCzT1QCFA_w.text: I've been this place twice for dinner and it never never let me down! Yakitori here tasted so much better than Ichiza and En Sushi period!! I really enjoyed asparagus wrapped with bacon, shishito peppers, gizzards, beef tongues, and tofu mousse as desert. They just tasted like the authentic way they should be done. And if you like plum wine, must try Kokuto Ume Shu!!!!!!!!! It's a blend of Japanese plum with brown sugar on ice rock. I was so in love with this plum wine after I had the first taste of it. Mmmmmm.. After my second visit, I still want to give it 2 thumbs up. It's so worth to drive 30 mins to here from the other side of town.

T1wRLRc43xKDO508fsy3BQ.text: My family is in love with Kyara. We live in Utah and come to Las Vegas 2-3 times a year. Ever since a couple years ago, we have been coming to Kyara at least once each trip. It never gets old! The only thing I would recommend is putting Tororo Udon on the menu. (My favorite Japanese dish!) Love this place and hope that they continue to flourish in business!

DTSE9m9n5BwaJCCF2XT3OQ.text: I really like how there's happy hour between 12am - 2am, perfect for a late night grub!

S1FJu0QnVwG0eYrv7QvZbA.text: Ugh hate this place now! Such a horrible service.. I always go here and I always tip 20% or sometimes maybe even more and tonight's service sucked and it didn't even look busy. I came in told them my order right up front and I waited for an hour! Not exaggerating. The guy next to me ordered ten minutes AFTER I ordered and he got his food before me. People who came in AFTER me got their food BEFORE me. As much as I love their sushi, never coming here again. Just freaking ruined my night....

pYPyqANn0QySeudlRWM8TA.text: We had a great time at this delightful Japanese shoebox.   Had reservations, got right in, reservations were at the bar. That being said, this is not a large place. This is not even a medium sized place. They have a few tiny table seating areas off of a main bar/kitchen area. It's all very nice. They yell something in Japanese(?) when you walk in and leave.  Our waiter was courteous and had good recommendations. We had two different "Shochu" drinks, I expect these are similar to the "Soju" beverages we had at Soyo that were so delectable.  The food was fresh and interesting. The veggie spring rolls were superb, The tempura was delightful and crisp, Garlic potatoes were excellent and I had a beefy sprouty dish that was spectacular. This is the first time I've had Japanese that wasn't Sushi (or burgers at Bachi), so please forgive my being unable to explain what it was, just know it was all very good.  My wife and I really enjoyed being that close to the kitchen (1.5 feet overlooking) and got to see the care of how everything was made.   We had food, drinks, alcoholic and non, and five Tapas for less than fifty bucks. I was impressed.

fAerpIev95Rl8nqzuJTNsw.text: We visited this place on our way to Vegas. This rating is for their lunch menu only. They offer a limited amount of food at lunch. We came in after reading all the awesome review so we were kinda disappointed. However, the quality of the food is good. I probably will try to come back at dinner time.  The interior is very nice and clean.

ocVsxg86CdVJohfZXRqdQQ.text: This place is awesome for tapas and drinks (but i don't drink haha) It's small but comfy and opens pretty late. We always order the gyu tan (so tender!), enoki bacon, chawanmushi, spicy ahi dip served w/ rice crackers (which I absolutely cannot get over!). The chicken garlic ponzu is soooo good, it's a definite must try! We tried a new dish today, it's called niku tofu.. YUM! The staff is friendly and always makes you feel welcome. It's a good size menu but I kinda wish they had a little more, I'm so used to looking at a big menus. Overall everything is awesome

U5hKVEQr2TUOgzbXZ10qfA.text: It was a toss up between going here or Ichiza.  Since we've been to Ichiza before, we went with the new place.  It was nice to try, but I think Ichiza has the edge.  We called and made reservations which is good because Ichiza doesn't do that.  On to the food.  We ordered a bunch of items.  Some of the notables were:  Pork Belly Skewers - I liked the one with sauce more than the salted one.  Definitely good to try Spicy tuna with cracker - Disappointing.  Wasn't spicy at all and the tuna had a strange consistency.   Kimchi with Pork - Good.  nothing really notable, but good. Stewed beef with potato - Really good.  Almost sukiyaki-esque.  One of my favorite dishes of the night Yellowtail with Chili - Very good.  Beautiful presentation and the flavors really accented each other well  The decor and presentation of the food was very nice.  The only down side was the service.  It was pretty slow and they missed some items that we ordered (but we were charged for them on the bill).  I caught the mistakes and got it fixed up.  Overall, good place to try out and share lots of different dishes, but I'll try to get Ichiza early next time.

6IN1sMisNZC_eSRoBflh4A.text: Pretty weak experience here.  Food is all bland and boring.  Spend $100 for two people here and I cant really remember what it went to.  The yellowtail collar was dry and bland.  The chowanmushi was good...uni too.  Service is good here I must say though, but wen only went here because ichiza was packed.

VHM9ZzbV1IOEVDgffuLtdQ.text: The place is a nice execution of the small plates concept that has been popping up around town.  It is like Ichiza with better decor.  I like sitting at the bar so I can watch the chefs work their magic.  I liked the place so much that I am going to host a meetup there.  The clams that I had were simmering in a flavorful broth.  The staff was attentive to my requests.  Overall - good job.

jWxnjDpmWiuINctxXiE0nw.text: Great little place in the style of Japanese izakaya. Try all the different kinds of food on sticks (kushi), especially butabara and teba for an authentic experience. Staff is very nice and attentive. Also, the tofu mousse dessert is not to be missed!

HDi5sEPQOzOOF1gkubpHbw.text: Today was my third time to go to Kyara for lunch (gave them 5 stars on 12-6).  Guess what I ate.  A sandwich from Tropical Smoothie next door.  The first time I went to Kyara, I was seated quickly and had the best Japanese food I have had in Las Vegas.  The second time, there were two customers waiting in front of me in the foyer and it took way too long to be seated and even longer to get my food (which was great again).  Today, a group of 5 entered just before me.  We were waiting forever, all the while the waitress was doing a lot of nothing.  The counter was wide open and I asked if I could sit there and was told to wait.  She finally sat the group of 5, then ignored me for a few more minutes.  Then, she came and told me there were tons of orders and the wait for food would be really long.  All this at 11:55 a.m.  She basically told me to leave.  I love the food here and have heard the night menu really rocks but after living in Japan for 20 years, customer service rules supreme.  Bottom line is the kitchen can't keep up with the seating capacity and they try to stall when busy at lunch.  I'm really torn about going back to Kyara.  I love the food but hate being treated like they could give a shit about whether I do or don't.  I'll probably give it a month or so then try going a little earlier for lunch.  For today, however, I'm pissed.  All was not a wash.  It was my first time to try Tropical Smoothie and the sandwich and smoothie were both great.

SVYlEM-flc7nZT6lPjIDpg.text: Amazing lunch deals!  Get the Spicy Tuna bowl set!  The best I've ever had!

rj4v-OBZTCyYWujDvkdxCQ.text: I came here for lunch. Finally! Been dying to try this place out. Definitely was disappointed. The ambience is nice. The food is good but the service was horrible. I don't like waiting to be seated and have the hostess walk past me 4x and not say either hello, or I'll be right with you. That is a HUGE pet peeve of mine. And,it was lunch, they weren't busy. But whatever. When I finally asked her, yes,I asked her if I could be seated, she wanted to out me at the sushi bar.  I wanted a table. She said, well, it's a really small table. I said, ok, it's just me,I don't mind. She seemed annoyed. Girly, we are not starting off well here. She put me at a table for 2 with no silverware, no condiments (the cute S&P and soy sauce) that were on other tables. Really sured my mood. Anyway,I ordered the salmon miso combo. Salad was great. Miso was good. Tempura should have been hotter but was good. Salmon was yummy. But I  didn't love this place. Service wld have made this 4 star no doubt. I'll still be on my quest for great Japanese food. I'll skip this place next time.

1IUnCxIuFrJajdh3c_OVMw.text: Food I ordered was good but I feel like they don't have enough options. Be prepared to order a lot of servings and food if you can eat like me.

loks6VR37W3wAcPCyStokQ.text: When this place first opened, I used to frequent often. The food is good, the prices for lunch are even better, and the service used to be really great. The location is very small to start with, few tables, and a few bar seats and that is it.   The last two times I've gone in before todays visit, its been super long waits just to get an order in, to get your drink refilled is next to impossible, but the food does come quick once ordered. I guess because they are so busy they have lost it in customer service. It took me twenty minutes to flag a waitress down just to pay my check on the previous visit, which is why I havnet been back for sometime. I went today and waited 10 minutes before a hostess would even make eye contact or ask how many in my party, then told me it would be about 15 to 20 more minutes to get seated. I left being that I'm on my lunch hour and all. I'm frustrated with the lack of service they have here. I told myself I wouldn't be coming here any time soon the last time I went and now I will definately not go back to this place at all,  the food is not superb or anything its just good, but not worth the wait or frustration.

yHLgb2U006Un-00sW58DMg.text: Great food in this tucked away small restaurant. Good atmosphere, good service. Poke is so fresh here. Tapas stye food in generous portions. Tofu dessert was well done. Price is very reasonable for the quality you get

8pwN-Y4HvGQXsMuPZHQWJQ.text: More people NEED to goto this place. The food is fantastic, servers are very pleasant, and the prices are 50% less than NYC and LA for food that as at least as good, if not better.

p3uukfNzenJzP5xAxlu9lw.text: Kyara, without a doubt is for the truly authentic Japanese foodies out there. The atmosphere is great, they have a very modern interior which is both intimate with music to match the setting. It makes you feel like you just stepped foot in Japan. The food is absolutely fantastic! They have different specials every time we go, which is about once a week and they taste heavenly! If you're the flavor over portion person, which is the actual Japanese dining style, you will not be disappointed. But if you are in need of a fill up after a period of fasting, it may be costly since the portions are designed to enjoy the flavor of each and every dish rather than filling up.They bring you unique and tasty "otoshi" in the beginning to start off which is a bite size but tasty. My personal fave are their delicious ham-katsu(which i can't find anywhere!), yakitori (tsukune and negima) and yamaimo somen (potato noodles), zukedon (maguro bowl) yum! If you're in the area, it 's definitely worth a try.

Hql8JEHoV_6a62Xg5Rjh6w.text: I totally disagree with all the other reviews. This place was recommended to me by the sushi chefs at MOzen of Mandarin Oriental. After reading the reviews, I became hesitant to try it, but I decided to go as the chefs had a positive feedback. Thank goodness for listening to them, because the food was delicious and authentic!! I am Japanese, so it really reminded me of a high quality izakaya in Tokyo. Everything we ordered was so well-balanced: seafood chawan-mushi, age-mochi, niku-tofu, halibut tempura with shiso and cheese, buta-kimchee....all the kushi-yaki was great, sashimi platter was beautifully presented and was fresh. I mean, it was a real pleasant surprise. We wanted to order more but we were so full from trying so many things. Nothing was a disappointment. In conclusion, I am a fan of this place and I'm super glad that the other reviews did not deter me from checking out this place.

CMvpmcptVVZLbTbisBWWkg.text: This is probably one of the best Japanese tapas. We've been here multiple times in the past couple years. Service is always excellent. We've tried almost all of their dishes and everything is delicious. Our go to order for skewers are pork cheek, beef tongue, shiitake mushroom, chicken wings. Tsukune is a must try with cage free egg. We also love yuzu chilli salmon salad, yellowtail jalapeno carpaccio. Saki ika tempura, and sausage are delicious. Mini udon and some of their seasonal noodle are always good options to try. Finally house sushi rolls we've tried all of them and everything is amazing our favorite is dejavu. Seasonal dishes are always good to try as well. Overall, you will never be disappointed coming here.

I came in this evening and needless to say left after 40 mins.  We were able to order drinks and an appetizer but no one ever came back to check if we were "ok".  We sat at the bar and the restaurant was getting full so I understand the wait however when I asked if we could order dinner, we waited another 15 mins and decided to get the check instead. UWC-4MnfeGtFXyPCTv1VYw.text: SUCH A CUTE PLACE!  **2017 Yelp 100 Challenge LV #9**  This place is nice & bright along w/ the decor being very simple & clean which I like the most! The bathrooms even have mouth wash for you freshen your breath after you eat. There are about 10 seats MAX at the bar top & maybe 8 tables of 4 around the restaurant. They also have an open kitchen so it could get pretty loud when the rush comes.  The staff is attentive but they really need to work on smiling a bit & greeting people when they walk through the door. They kind of seem like they don't wanna be working. But regardless they are attentive so I don't really expect much of GREAT MEMORABLE service from this joint. The food makes up for it.   This is another izakaya Japanese restaurant which is like small plates.  KORO KORO STEAK $14.80 - literally OBSESSED w/ this dish. so MUCH FLAVOR & I love the bean sprouts that I like to eat w/ a bowl of rice.  IKURA DON $15 - I love how perfect their sushi rice is In FLAVOR & TEXTURE. this goes the same for the sweet & savory flavors of the SALMON ROE!!  ENOKI BACON $2.50 MOCHI BACON $2.50 KOEBI AGE $5.80 IKA GESO AGE $3.80

u-jLEOlLAmNtEueE3dOo6w.text: I go to this nice little spot every once in a while, but I'm met with excellent service and great food every time.   I have to say that I'm a huge fan of the interior design of the establishment. It's got a beautiful contemporary Japanese aesthetic, but it has a essence of a relaxed and laidback atmosphere just like any other izakaya.   They have an extensive menu catered to both Japanese and Western tastes. There are a lot of traditional Japanese dishes like chawan mushi and niku jaga, but there are plenty of other creative options such as koro koro steak, garlic potatoes, and spicy edamame. Not to mention they have a great selection for yakitori and sushi.   I personally love their ika geso age (fried marinated squid legs) and tori karaage (Japanese fried chicken). Both lightly battered and fried, accompanied by subtly sweet and savory flavors.   There's just so much to try here, so if you're feeling adventurous, this is the place to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nb8ANcF5qdw1Q_Yt0E4wkA.text: Nice service.  Nice atmosphere. Okay food. Pricey small tapas that left me wishing I had done more research on this place before coming here.  The food was hit or miss. Some tapas were good (takoyaki, mini udon, fried chicken), some were not, for example the seafood gratim was very small and had only one tough chewey overcooked scalop in it.

LTsXHeN9dYZ5s1UQebnuJA.text: Very disappointed Kyara closed for lunch. It was our favorite for lunch. We felt their prices were too low. If they would increase prices, maybe they could reopen??  We would definitely love that.

Servers were on top of their game and sushi chef we sat in front of was so focused but had a wonderful smile as he so politely handed us our order of salmon belly & thanked us for waiting. We will be back again!

On a Friday night, we waited about 30-40 minutes to be seated.  Server was cool.  This place is NOT huge. Mostly locals. Parking is plentiful.  Venue is easy to find.
