If you need to stay in business you might wanna step up your game. This was really a bad experience.

z_1Ppe3dYet8G3od53VTxw.text: Highly recommended by friends, we decided to visit Kyara last March 23, 2015. My sashimi plate was so freshly delicious, it's now my favorite.  We also had soft shell crab, grilled octopus, pork belly skewers which were all tasty as well. m_hQg2f8885L7ZBKKjbEZg.text: ***Highlights***: ANOTHER GUILTY PLEASURE! But you have to like Japanese Japanese food. QUALITY, not Quantity. Love their late night hours.   Negatives: The only negative I can think of is that the food comes out in no particular order. But then again, this is really they only way they can maintain that authentic great quality of their food.   Price/Food: Food is amazing. As clean and traditional as you are really going to get in Las Vegas. Fresh Fish, Salted Skewers, and my favorite Ume Ochazuke. Remember this is Tapa style eating though. That bill will run up quickly. I have easily spend $65 on 2 people, not even including drinks.  Service/Ambiance: This place is really cozy and small. Great to catch up with friends, have a first date, or even to just eat alone. I love that I can sit down by myself, or sit at the sushi bar, and have a quality meal at 1am without feeling like a weirdo. NOT FOR KIDS! Not because they are not accommodating of children or anything.. but why spend $10 on your 2 year old. I love the sophisticated adult atmosphere, lets keep it that way.

8pePsLFZK5kcy6UgICJW2Q.text: Went to Kyara tonight for dinner. Food was on point tonight. We ordered takoyaki, beef tongue, and a couple of rolls. Everything was tasty and satisfying. The servers were attentive and friendly.   Now the bummer- like a previous reviewer mentioned-we sat on the left side of the restaurant and was it uncomfortable. It was extremely stuffy and warm. I think they were aware of the stuffiness because they had a vertical fan set up to circulate the air. Not a good sign. We almost walked out but decided to stay. Despite the good food we will think long and hard about returning until they get their A/C fixed. Extreme bummer. We like this spot and it is only minutes from our house. Beware!

HdLAtu9l-QYfF36Rm52qNg.text: Great Food and AMAZING customer service. These are the must have : Pork Cheek, Pork Belly, Beef Tounge and Saba Shio. If you still have room, they serve the best sushi in town as well.

2eoSnXZ6OzokklbYJAkLaQ.text: Even though they messed up my order they promptly fixed it and even gave me extra. Very good service. Clean restrooms. Cute restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beef shabu-shabu and spinach salad....I ate like half already lol. Delish.
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is inside I believe you have option to sit behind the curtain ore bar. cute and romantic. Rest room is very clean!

XzZ4U0Lj2uyRih42LOqKmg.text: Good takoyaki, creamy on the inside. Texture like mayo, could taste the tender squid. The contrast of creamy and chewy is amazing. Oh did I mention that it's crispy on the outside? And $3 for 6 at happy hour. Would come back for more!

X5BbtM6kLfXS22GLsiuYiw.text: This place never disappoints! Prices are always decent for spek-a-tala-lar food! I come here for the rapongi roll and all the specialties of the given month. Be sure to arrive with an empty belly because you will definitely leave with a full belly and a fat smile on your face.

HXNvnK6P5NTWi7FLSWfu3g.text: New favorite Japanese Tapas Place. Price is slightly more than my other go to spots but the atmosphere here makes me feel like I'm in Japan.

WrsB7xcLNBJyVUmt8fY0CA.text: We got overly excited to be here and ordered wayy to much food, but all of it was delicious and I regret nothing.  This is located in a small shopping center away from the strip. I don't imagine tourists usually find their way here, but a local business owner recommended this place to us, and we were gratefully satisfied. We didn't have a reservation, so we did have to wait 20 minutes. I think that's reasonable for a Saturday night. The food and atmosphere reminded me of being at an Izakaya in Ikebukuro the last time I visited Tokyo. The prices were also reasonable.  We ordered: Spicy Tuna Roll, Salmon Sashimi Bowl, Shoyu Ramen, Cheese Tempura, Skewers of Asparagus/Bacon, Mochi/Bacon, Enoki/Bacon, Shitake Mushrooms, and Kara age. Every single thing ordered tasted wonderful, but our two favorites were the sashimi bowl and cheese tempura. The tempura was unconventional, but we were pleasantly surprised with how absolutely delicious the mozzarella, gouda, and havarti were.  The next time I'm in Vegas, I'm avoiding any "asian" food on the strip and coming directly here!

uEZM7jtvk-UutnxOO-csrw.text: Good place to eat!  We are ready to order skewers and noodles!! I like the Japanese style decoration

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice place to eat dinner!

dG44KsgnuY6LZ7PZ-PWH2A.text: I am a regular at this place and I love it. Their happy hour is amazing. My favorite dishes are the spicy garlic edamame, gyoza, ika butter, spicy tuna bowl, the kushi's, and more.   My husband and I come here all the time. Brian is our favorite server EVER! He is the best and always helps us out a lot.   I LOVE THIS PLACE

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy garlic edamame

xje3sTJf-Zy8kb0XhvUqfQ.text: Do you have those places, that whenever you go, you wonder why you don't come more often? Kyara Japanese Tapas is one of them for me...so good!  Most recently I came here with my Love after yoga around 9pm. Luckily we got seats at the bar in front of the Sushi Chef. I love chefs!... Love watching chefs making sushi, rolling up rolls, cutting them into perfect pieces, putting the last garnish on the dish...all beautiful and fascinating...and I enjoyed immensely watching Chef at Kyara.  Service is always on point...suggesting different cuts of sushi available, specials of the day, etc. we enjoyed everything from Nigiri to Izakaya...but my favorites of the night were Baby Octopus Shio Kara Age and Soft Shell Shrimp. Kara Age was so crunchy and wonderfully flavorful, with just enough salt, and some brightness provided by the fresh squeezed lemon for a perfect amount of acid. For the shrimp, you just bite into it from head to tail...oishii!  I will certainly make a point to come back here at Kyara Japanese Tapas more often!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Japanese Drinks
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Baby Octopus Shio Kara Age
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

R3j84Rs0vBznWokK6_9J3w.text: I have been here a few times over the years and I finally remembered to snag some photos!   Now, the skewers are the main reason I come. I could have a couple of the Pork Cheek and Gyu Tan, a bowl of rice and I am solid! I also never leave without the cheese tempura.. because who doesn't like gooey fried melty cheese?!   Do not get wrong though, the sushi here is amazing. But unfortunately, my friend is allergic to fish so this trip is definitely meat focused. We also got the rib eye and the kurobuta sausage which the steak was under seasoned but they keep salt and ichimi (chili powder) on the table which is just fine for me.   I ordered the negi shio takoyaki special for myself and I have to say it was not a hit. It was overly salted and there was a lot of shio so it did make it pretty soggy. Back to regular takoyaki next time!!   Enjoy your time here, because I have every single time!

ZdJhHnLDJLPJ_ZwhJ-AFZg.text: Been coming here for years! I went M.I.A. For a bit after having a couple bad experiences... felt like they fell off and weren't consistent anymore, but decided to come back for sake and beer and it's been phenomenal since! I'm sooo obsessed with the intestines. Absolutely love all the skewers!! Chicken skin, gizzards, pork cheek, pork belly, and beef tongue!   If you're looking for great tapas and trying to have a few drinks Kyara is in my top 5 places for sure!   Best late night eats and happy hour!

LWPExLYFm-Jmp8myJiAYqQ.text: This place is beautiful and the food is delicious!! The service definitely measures up to the top standards that "fancy" restaurants are at.  My husband and I decided to have an early dinner here on a Wednesday evening. I think we were one of the first customers so we were promptly seated. Our waiter, (I'm so bad remembering names) but he was just wonderful!! He was so attentive and polite and was able to answer all of our questions.  We mentioned that were celebrating our wedding anniversary and he actually brought us a matcha waffle dessert to make our dining experience complete.  We are definitely coming back and ordering more of the kushi tapas. They have a great variety to choose from. Our favorite?? Pork belly and pork cheek!!! Cooked to perfection!! Beef tongue comes in close!! The baby octopus was so good, we had two orders...  You just have to come and try and it for yourself!!

9riOo2Buwms51pTQ0TedFw.text: Very good local Japanese spot in the area if you're craving for all of the tasty classic dishes found at izakayas. Their yakitori isn't the best, however -- have to head over to Chinatown. Here, I find their yakitori lacking charcoal flavor, and was a bit dry.  We binged on their specials menu, which included salmon belly, uni, chutoro, and more. Definitely not the cheapest place, so everything added up quickly. I would definitely come back if I don't feel like driving to Chinatown. They open late until 2am, so that's a plus.

TYQYNwdSYvbbOdhEOqH0iA.text: This place has the best happy hour!! You have to get the corn and definitely the garlic potatoes. Everything is good and service is A+++

2Ly8HOz8VV0XrOjpCEz2Yw.text: My sister wanted to go here for lunch after hearing that this place had good Japanese food.  This place was not near where we live. It was a bit of a drive to get there.   Nice Japanese ambiance. Friendly staff. Good selection on their menu.   Food- Udon had no taste. (not pictured)  Sashimi was good.  Miso salmon combination was good. Miso soup, salad & tempura was good. Sushi was good.  Tofu dessert was eh. I wouldn't order that again.  Iced green tea was good   We were over charged on our bill but it was quickly resolved.   Overall it was ok. I would eat here again if I was in the area and I wanted Japanese food but I wouldn't drive out of my way to go here.

lQs0hPfGJijfUHMfhlIYqA.text: This is a must to dine at. The food is very authentic and fresh. Staff is helpful and the menu is extensive. There is something for everyone.   Kyste os open late so it is a fabulous place for late night tapas and sushi.   Prices are reasonable and the quality is worth a visit. We would highly recommend this establishment.

n3gKungCZM7ZW5BOWtM7ww.text: I love this place, so much that I come every week. Of course I sometimes do demand the chef to make me something special because I probably can memorize their big menu already.  Haha. They have so many dishes here even my American husband can appreciate. The service has always been really sweet as well.

5bioaMoC1lcrbC1l7yzv_A.text: The food and service was fantastic! I will be coming here again! Our server Djinde was very nice and attentive! She brought the food out in a timely manner and always checked up on us.

YSjSVavMg1iBfJcc4cGr0A.text: Another fav tapas restaurant of mine, probably among my top 3 in Las Vegas.   I'm always here during their happy hour, which starts at 10pm until 2am everyday. It is the perfect spot for after hour cravings for food, but want something a little bit better than your typical late night fast food restaurant. It is also a great place to have some drinks because of how much discounted alcohol there is to choose from on their happy hour menu. This menu has changed a couple of times, but as of April 2019, my favorite happy hour item is the ika butter (squid) and the cabbage rayu (Japanese chili oil). I definitely suggest trying both for some chewy savory bites alongside some fresh tasty greens. For dessert, I really enjoy the matcha waffle, even though it's full price. It's 2 delicious green tea matcha waffles with vanilla ice scream and a small scoop of sorbet, served with melted butter and honey. Delicious!  Another thing I really like about this place is that even though it's a popular tapas restaurant, there is almost never a long wait and that there's always a lot of parking.

_jB9ZLVu3ZFoClK7D8PXxQ.text: This place is the bomb! I frequent there with my boyfriend on late nights, sometimes for happy hour. The food is always on point and we rarely have tried something that we don't enjoy. The Tapas style restaurant is fun because you can order a bunch of different things and get a little of everything! The staff is so so awesome and attentive, it seems they all work on a team to take care of the guests and it goes a long way. They get pretty busy so on the weekends you might expect a short wait but they are usually quick about it. I can't say enough good things about Kyara...love,love,love!

RmKfMHTu1bYzUS-PyHGEPQ.text: Byran is the best server ! Highly recommended to ask for him.   We love tapas and glad the this restaurant is here.

GW2UL8RPhG7-Eu6-j_Biyg.text: Heard many great reviews about this location and wanted to check out what all the hype was about. A nice cozy location right off the 215 and next to Sambalatte coffee shop. We came during the hours of 11-3. I assume the business closes before dinner time to prep and reopens from 5-2am.   It may be because we came before there dinner closing around 3pm but after we were seated. It almost took 20 minutes before I had to ask a server if we could order. I usually don't do reviews about the staff but this particular visit was below satisfying. There were other guests seated next to us and already eating. The waiter at the time didn't acknowledge us until I brought up the point that we were waiting.   Regardless, the food was very good. The lunch special we had received was delicious. Though they were out of the streak potion. The chicken was on point!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kyara&#39;s Lunch Special with chicken.

H82Pu3gAH-c5XvgisTt8bQ.text: I've been here for years and the food never disappoints. I always order the beef, intestines skewers, tongue, and squid. SO good! Brian was so attentive and provided great service at all times.

dux8-n6-66T_0QhWhCBdig.text: After hours of debating, a group of us finally decided on Kyara. I thought it was gonna be really great because after that lengthy of a debate, it had to be something special. All in all, it was meh. My favorite out of everything we got was the salmon and ikura bowl, which was almost $13. I wish it was a little bigger.   What bugged me a tad was the fact that almost everything came out in the beginning to the point where we barely had space on the table, and then the bowl came out at the very end. I wish they could have spaced it out better. Not gonna lie, I didn't pay for this meal but I remember seeing the bill and knowing that it wasn't worth what we had.

Y-I3YHGL4xYdCoaWPlSWgw.text: Love this place! Happy hour prices for drinks is literally one of the best deals around. My fiance and I come here on Sunday nights after 10 and usually there is no wait at all.   Our typical order:  Yaki onigiri w/ume- The rice is grilled perfectly. Not too hard on the outside. And recently there have been a lot of ume in the rice ball which is a plus. A must try with the Yakitori.   Spicy tuna bowl- For $5 it's a decent price. Tuna is a little bland but nothing that soy sauce can't fix.   Negi chicken & tsukene skewer- both meats are grilled nicely. Not dry and negi chicken is marinated well.   Tori karaage- fluff, crisped and juicy. One of my favorite items   Agedashi tofu- Dashi broth was a little bland this time around. Bonito flakes would probably add a lil more flavor.   Service is always amazing here. Food comes out in a timely manner and servers always checks up on us.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Dul2tn69ToHqlS-WHCjM8Q.text: Kyara is my favorite late night dinner place to go! I love all the specials they have, the combination skewers (my absolute favorite is the okra) and all the korean dishes they have on the menu. This is the perfect place to go if you love sushi and have friends who only eat cooked food. They also have a selection of sake and make mixed drinks with sake. Service is very kind and friendly and if you want to drop in for dinner make sure you come early so you can get seated right away!

_wG3paQSe15Kz0d_pH_6HA.text: Thanks to Yelp for steering me to Kyara for a 11:00 dinner. Nice variety of dishes with prices that made it easy to explore the menu. Especially appreciated that they added my name to the wait-list when I called at 10:30 to double-check that they were indeed open late.  Highlight for me was the seared steak with garlic, ginger, wasabi and chives on the side. I will return when I'm back in Las Vegas next and this time I'll bring some friends so that we can share twice as many items as I was able to handle on my own. Very easy to get to for an out-of-towner - right off of the highway. Recommended.

7TVQnDzRZZkR3c_7zzn_tw.text: Food was ok I've had had better ...service horrible as a customer I know in my head how many dishes I ordered and this server comes  and tries to argue that I ordered 4 dishes , instead of being apologetic  she tried to argue her point , I go to the manager  and he just shrugs his shoulders with no efforts to make the situation better!!! Honestly guys you need a lesson in customer service , the non speaking servers were more accommodating . Wait time 30 minutes for 3 itty bitty sticks of food with no offer of water as I waited , just a small glass of wine all for freaking 15 bucks and I'm not full and I lost my appetite after that . Was planning to order more but changed my mind after that.Go to gyu kaku at Decatur or Yojie    Sahara .Better service and your belly will be full. Never coming back to this place . Ichiza maybe crowded but they have more choices hence people lining up even at 2:00 AM , as I said I've had had better than this restaurant can offer.  If you make the mistake of eating here , make sure you order about 5-6 or even 10 of their tapas to get your fill ,order at once so your 30 minute wait is worth it and you get out of there  within one hour , make sure your server listens to you and ask her /him to repeat what you ordered, from other reviews long wait time and getting the wrong orders and poor customer service are the main issues that will surely keep me away  . You have been warned .

LKIgFwj8ZzWeY79lQDw4VA.text: I happened to be in the area so I decided drop by. It was late and I wasn't that hungry but I'm always down for some foodie adventures. Based on the Yelp reviews, I ordered the garlic chicken ponzu and the kushi mori. The garlic chicken ponzu came out first and it seemed a little underseasoned. The chicken was good but not great. I don't think I'd order it again. The kushi mori comes with an assortment of different meats and veggies which I loved. My favorites were the chicken wing and pork belly. During cooking, the meats are based with a soy based sauce which I enjoyed thoroughly. The decor inside is casual but I wouldn't have a problem bringing a first date in here. I'm planning to return very soon and eat some more of their yummy pork belly kushis!

xulPTh9zzavSGiyjUfhJ5Q.text: I consider Kyara to be a good one night stand kinda' joint.  This is the only Japanese Tapa centered venue I know of in Vegas, so here I come.  You step inside into a very quaint japanese style village of a place.  The customer service was on point and the food was great.  The only problem I had was that the menu was so extensive and most of the items were foreign to me, so it was kinda' hit and miss when ordering.  Don't get me wrong.. all the dishes we ordered were great.. but not all dishes were worth paying for because of its small portion.  If they ever one day offer an AYCE menu, you can bet I'll be one of the regulars!

BoG7hbamai8pVAm1wYktog.text: YUM. My friends had been raving about this place so one night we all decided to stop by after work for a late dinner. The prices were great and the selection was even cooler. We got a whole bunch of dishes ranging from soup to tofu to steak. Everything tasted delicious! I had the tofu pudding for dessert and it was awesome. My only complaint was that the desserts my friends went there for were sold out. Bummer! But that just means we have to go back again soon!!!

GTkdu368LlBARjVaQCn7LQ.text: As a Naked Fish customer of many years (since 2005...and with their rare "member" card), a die-hard loyal fan (I almost never try other places) and someone who has brought much business to them, including as personal and work caterers, I suppose I set my standards in customer service very high for this place and that might have set me up for the disappointment of this new restaurant.  I missed Wanda's energy, Miyuki's warmth...and the other staff (although I've noticed there are many new waitstaff now at NF - and I saw on NF staff now at this location).   And the reason it was missed is because the customer service was probably the worst I've experienced at any restaurant.  When I walked in, I waited for a minute - it was almost empty with a couple at the bar, some folks in a booth.  No one greeted me but then a waiter named Seoul (Sol?) came up and asked me what I wanted and I said, "I'd like to sit down and eat please.".  Then, I don't understand why confusion ensued.  He asked me three times if I was eating.  Finally, I said, "I'd just like to eat - I can sit at the bar, thanks!".   The waitstaff behind the counter did't acknowledge me - it was like I was invisible, what a great first visit!  I sit and wait for the menu and observe all other customers after me being greeted (by all staff there) and Sol takes my drink order.  I say, "Water, no ice please....".  He comes back with ice and water.  It's really not a big deal but I do note how NOT busy it is at that point...and how NOT very attentive he is being.  I order Cabbage no Zaki giri "Taberu Rayu", Spicy Tuna no Dip and Yamaimo Teppan.  And unlike another reviewer, didn't expect them to be so large (the Yamaimo Teppan was too much for me - mountain potato and ponzu on a hot plate).  I thought the cabbage was a large serving as well but this isn't a complaint.  Just to give others an idea about how large the servings are - it would have been better for two people.  The cabbage was awesome.  It's basically uncooked cabbage (raw) with a spicy oil on it that reminded me a little of the red oil they use in Sichuan, China.  I felt guilty ordering it though because it looks like I can make it at home.  But it was delicious...  The Spicy Tuna with the Rice crackers was tasty as well; I was happy with that.  The quality of the food is what I expected from Naked Fish.  The Yamaimo Teppan might not be for everyone although it was great to try; it's shredded potato baked with an egg, topped with bonito flakes, negi and nori.  If you're vegan and don't eat eggs, just fyi this has eggs in it (and fish) although it doesn't state on the menu.  It is also baked, not stir-fried it seems, which is the category it's under.  Some of it was a bit undercooked for my taste but overall, I think it just had an interesting flavor.  You should definitely try its uniqueness if you enjoy new tastes.  The food came quickly - except for the mountain potatoes.  I like that they have an open kitchen before you at the bar and you can see all that goes on - great idea.  Sol warmed up and checked on me one time (maybe because I was looking at the Sake menu - cha-ching!$ - at that moment).  Or maybe because he is genuinely a very good, caring and attentive waiter.  I'll believe the latter but give 2 stars for now.  I will go back one more time (they have an amazing menu!) and hopefully things will be different with customer service or they'll never have to seat me again.

Fb67ns7xY1qVAo_F6-mzOQ.text: Dont listen to crap ass yelpers... Place is da' bomb... Sit at bar and get the real.... Secret oyster shooters r unbelievable... Tired of people on the web trashing good spots because they r used to chilis & applebees.... Maybe u should all know how to order food & act correctly in a place that has some of the best chefs & staff & unstuff that napkin in ur ass & open ur mind.... Been here 10 times & never a negative experience.... U dont like kyara then dont come back.... By me & wifeys house & wont miss u fools!!! Love u kyara!!!!

y7C9Vx_-dFsuQDG_b7lNkQ.text: This is place is pretty amazing! I have only been there for lunch! But every time I go it's always the same quality food and great service! I really loved combination lunch they server there. It's affordable and tastey the same time!

JNxMFVbux6yGv9ajuiLN9Q.text: The food was good and is set-up to order a nice variety. Everything we had was delicious and the service was great.  Next visit we'll order a little more.

dqhxYnTwocR3AQfFgEhi-g.text: **Summary** - Flavor - Everything we had was either good or great. It was definitely a treat for the taste buds. - Authentic - From the decor to the staff to the food, this is truly an authentic Japanese Izakaya place. - Skewers - The sauce they use for the skewers is phenomenal. If you sit at the bar you can see them watch over the skewers the whole time. They take care to cook them perfectly. - Value - You'll probably pay more here than getting a bento box elsewhere, but the portion size and flavor is well worth the price. - Ichiza - I finally found a place closer to my house that's like Ichiza but better. Now, if only they had honey toast, I'd never have to go to Ichiza again. **Appetizers** - $7.50 Yuzu Chili Salmon Salad - Five pieces of slightly seared salmon with arugula on the side. Salmon was fresh, texture was great, and the sauce gave it a little kick. (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). - $3.50 Garlic Potato - An interesting dish. Simple and good (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). - $3.80 Ikageso - Fried squid legs. If you like squid, it's pretty good. If you're expecting calamari, you might be disappointed. - $5.50 Gyutan - 6 thin slices of beef tongue. It's ok, but a little pricy for the amount you get (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). **Skewers** - $1.90 Shoniku - Chicken thigh & leg skewer. The sauce they use for this was awesome. A must try (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). - $1.90 Negi Ma - Chicken with onion skewer. I preferred the shoniku (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). - $2.20 Butabara - Pork belly. It has just the right amount of pork to fat ratio. - $1.90 Sunagimo - Chicken Gizzard skewer. The gf said this was good. I don't really like gizzards. **Mini Meals** - $5.00 Tori Meshi - Seasoned ground chicken on rice. Wasn't enough chicken. Nothing special. - $6.50 Maguro Zuke Don - Marinated tuna and rice. The marinade on the pieces of tuna sashimi was fantastic. You get about 7 pieces. They give you too much rice though. - $3.50 Mini Udon - A pretty decent sized portion for the price. The udon broth is better than most places (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). - $9.50 Koro Steak - A hefty portion of bite sized steak (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). **Misc** - $5.00 Chawan Mushi - Steamed egg custard (with shrimp, scallops, squid, and clams). It's pretty hard to find in Vegas. The only other place in Vegas I've seen it is at Ichiza. The one they serve here is better and they put a lot more seafood in it (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). - $6.50 Yamaimo Teppan - I expected deep fried potatoes and got potato paste. Needless to say, it wasn't good and pretty salty. - $6.50 Chocolate Fondant - Chocolate Souffle with a size of ice cream. Takes 15 minutes to make and is well worth it (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...). **Recommendations** - I'd recommend this place for anyone looking to treat themselves to some delicious non-sushi Japanese.

kgB6UE_5i7dNkRej9ur_Vg.text: I was skeptical at first, I've been to Raku, was thinking this could be disappointing but I was wrong for sure.  Had a great meal had to sashimi dishes that were very good.  Also the agedashi tofu, tomato skewers and pork cheek skewers were exceptional.  We ordered alcohol but just our food with tip would have been about $45 each which I think is a steal.

HDkNgr1VWTyEl9USz89rMg.text: This place has great service, food, interior, and atmosphere. I plan to come back again. Next time, I won't bring my mom nor brother-in-law for they are annoyingly rude, picky, racist, and inconsiderate. The food is absolutely delicious. Do NOT say things like "it's like ayce kbbq but it's more pricey". It's unjustly to compare this restaurant to another style of cooking and style that another country does. I came here to try the food and appreciate it as I savor it. I didn't come here to spend two hours listening to my guests be assholes and even making fun of Japanese customs and language while being INSIDE a japanese restaurant. I'm ashamed to know those two and I deeply apologize to Kyara for my guests' ill mannerisms. My brother-in-law was so eager to do "a trick" for my birthday with the use of the chopstick-rest and mini cups of syrup . I kept trying to stop him because I knew it would make a mess. He went for it anyway, spilled the ounce of melted butter (it was for the Matcha Waffle) which leaked through the tight space between our two tables and onto the floor. He didn't even want to notify an employee or clean up after himself. Then, he wanted to just messily dump a bunch of napkins on the floor and pass it off as "good enough". Sometimes it's not a restaurant's fault if there's a mess that didn't get cleaned up; sometimes it's the fault of an immature, irresponsible, asshole of a customer. The next few people that would have sat at our table would have judged the place unjustly no matter how great of a job they have done. I apologize to yelpers for this explanation, but I don't want Kyara to have lower ratings just because my brother-in-law caused a chain of bad impressions amongst the succeeding patrons of our table. Anyways, we had a lot of food since my mom didn't bother to try anything other than garlic shrimp and a california roll since she happens to be racist against other asian countries' food other than her home country and fake chinese food (the kind tweaked to american palates).  We ordered: -Tuna Carpaccio: that garlic chip and sauce adds such a nice touch to the flavor -Kobe Beef Tataki: comes with a mild dip and a slightly spicy dip -Tuna Poke Salad: tastes great. the seaweed salad seemed to taste a bit peanutty to me though -Shishito Peppers: my brother-in-law enjoyed it -Mochi Bacon: mmm squishy rice cake -Buta-Bara (pork belly): juicy -Ton Toro (pork cheeks): hardened a bit because i was focused on the beef, but still pretty good -Koro Koro Steak (diced cut rib eye steak): juicy. comes with bean sprouts on a sizzling plate -Soft Shell Crab: i believe we ended up ordering 8 -Agedashi Tofu: nice softness/firmness -Salmon Yaki Onigiri: N/A, took it home and ate the next day. -Mentaiko Yaki Onigiri: same response as above. -Takoyaki: i like it almost as much as Jinya Ramen's -Negi Takoyaki: comes with a dipping sauce -California Roll: N/A, i didn't try it -Sashimi 6 Kinds (tuna, salmon, yellowtail, halibut, albacore, ikura): heaven -Smelt Egg Nigiri: generous on the eggs -Garlic Shrimp: comes with caramelized onions. yum -Maccha/Matcha Waffle: comes with vanilla ice cream, a sorbet, cup of honey syrup, cup of melted butter. satisfying. harmonious when drizzled-to-taste Even though my mom and brother-in-law kept ruining my mood and appetite, I still found enjoyment in the food although I usually wouldn't have if I had eaten anything else and THAT'S how I'm able to say that Kyara has really good chefs.

qRUeYg-Tusk1fqehPKsvuw.text: When I think of eating in Las Vegas, I think of the gluttonous buffet. And while fun, I can honestly say that I would rather eat at Olive Garden. Needless to say, my visits to Vegas do not typically have memorable meals attached to them.  Tonight, I decided to follow Yelpers advice and try Kyara and I couldn't have been more pleased with my experience. The service and atmosphere are quite good, but the reason to go there is for the tapas - all of them gently prepared and REALLY good.  I first had an assortment of Kushiyaki (skewered veggies and meats) - they were perfectly cooked and flavorful (without sauces to mask their individuality). My favorite were the mushrooms (and I am not a huge shroom fan) and of course the shishito peppers (I could eat 100 of those).  I also highly recommend the spicy tuna dip. This is basically a really large scoop of very delicious spicy tuna served with fresh rice cakes. You pile the tuna on the cake and enjoy - perfect contrast between textures and temperature.  While they have a good menu of sake and spirits, I did not drink tonight. My total bill was under $30.  Kyara is worth the visit!

qt7CdyF5ulw1pWYqFHWX7g.text: Great service. Got food in a timely manner. Koro Koro Steak & Pork Kimchi were amazing.

2vaA8sIPDh9IW3nBPuQ0aQ.text: Definitely a hole in the wall!!!! I am so glad we stopped by and tried it even though they just opened. Seating is limited but it is very nice inside. The tapas are delicious and well-priced. A dinner for 2, we got full without eating any rice, is around $40-$50. Such a steal. We got the green tea soju drink and they made it stronger as we requested. I would recommend eating some dishes with rice because it did get a little salty by itself like the koro koro steak.

ywLvRhfeJuSRvFpUi3w9ow.text: So one of the first things that you see when you walk in here is the bar overlooking the kitchen where they do all the cooking.  I personally enjoy watching my food being cooked so my friend and I opted to sit there.  The menu is pretty simple, but I think that is a plus as they did everything well.  The prices were not bad either, but they can add up depending on how much you order.  I was pleasantly surprised with their chawanmushi, it was really flavorful, and more importantly wasn't overdone, it still jiggled just a wee bit.  It also had plenty of seafood in it which was very tasty.  Their fried chicken was also really really good, it was probably my favorite dish that we had that night.  Overall, food was tasty and promptly served, service was good, and getting there is easy.

hv6QT1_a6fIGmDKtqdkimg.text: I love Japanese food and this place is bomb.com!!! We ate the chicken karage, ika karage, two sushi rolls, takoyaki, and green tea waffle! everything was amazingly delicious and I would definitely eat here again!

4SnmAKKsdAG1BZI1Kin4kw.text: Hmmmmm hmmmmm maguro carpaccio so good! If you ever come out to Vegas this is the place to go. Warm and cozy place to eat even if it is away from the strip.

5944hOh2PfGhu6AIQkmJTQ.text: Excellent service.  Most importantly, it has very creative, new ways of serving sushi, sashimi and a host of Japanese hot dishes.  Would definitely recommend to friends and family.  Strongly suggest that you make reservations or get there early.

fa9gdOkJq7ZTWOvdGVwkgA.text: this place is ridiculous good!  went on friday night and was surprised that it wasn't more crowded, we didn't have to wait to get a table.  the atmosphere is chill with an open kitchen.  we ordered several things to try, my favorites being the grilled asparagus and yellowtail with jalapenos.  unfortunately we weren't able to try the koro koro steak that is so pumped up cause it was sold out.  oh well, next time.  also got the beef tongue which was good but definitely not as good as blue ribbon's which is the only other time i've had it so it was my only comparison (blue ribbon's btw made me want to push a babys soft spot in).  the service was good and the bill was very reasonable, just over $100 for food and booze.      i highly recommend this place, i will absolutely be going back.

P9IHibWV5wM5AvPaXpgKlw.text: As we really enjoy Naked Fish we thought we'd give this place a try as we had heard that it was owned by the same guy.  We were impressed and really enjoyed it.  Having eaten in some izakaya places in Japan, Kyara was a nice throwback to those.  The menu was probably bigger than the ones I have been to before, but the food was equally as good.  The service was spot on, and the servers recommendations were excellent.  Good value, nice ambiance, good food.

5Dit69s5Giy92LbW5Xor7w.text: Great place - you definitely need to go outside your comfort zone because you might be pleasantly surprised. I would recommend the chicken gizzards, beef tongue, chicken skin, and pork belly. I went on Okinawan night and enjoyed live music and pickled pigs ear. The Okinawan noodles were awesome too the meat on the spare ribs just melted off the bone. Wish they had nishime and kinpira gobo too! Service was very attentive and they explained what it was before dropping off the dish. Great atmosphere, casual, comfortable. The bathrooms were clean too, always a bonus.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Okinawan beer
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Okinawan noodles with spare rib
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Okinawan specials

WxbTXz23vspJI1-ChF3_iw.text: We were so impressed with this restaurant.  We went with a group of friends (6 people) and the staff was so friendly and very attentive. The food was so yummy and it was so much fun trying a little of everything. We were adventurous and tried the beef tongue and it was one of the best things we ordered. Plus we went on Okinawan night and they were playing live Okinawan music, it was amazing! Definitely recommend this restaurant!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EIBSnT5Ype5TgxVmZVgxuw.text: good lunch deals $10  pork katsu meal with salad, rice, soup, tempura  sashimi plate $10 - salmon, tuna, yellowtail 4 slices each, fresh

EH2BSVYqugX7QvTWREuvxw.text: If you come early for lunch, you will have the better experience.  It gets busy and service slows down during the lunch rush. Otherwise, this place is wonderful.  Their lunch specials are very good and worth the price.  You get a lot for the money. One of my favs for lunch!

lxNVclc8HFTEYYc5dLLY8Q.text: I tried here about 2 months ago. It was newly opened. So their interior and atmosphere gave me very clean impression.  I really like their interior. Some izakaya style restaurant is little bit too much. But Kyara are not. But the staffs were still energetic and welcoming the guests.  we ordered many things. Such as asparagus with bacon, gyutan(beef tongue), mixed tempura, chicked with ponzu sauce(sth like this..lol) with hot sake and plum wines. I don't remember exact name..   Anyway, foods are very good and we are very pleased. But one thing we weren't happy is choices.. They didn't have many choices.. its not like ichiza. If u looooooove ichiza, u can be disappointed here.  But if you wanna just drink some sake or enjoy some little Japanese tapas, then u r gonna like here.

0qsiQUPQ92aXcuQa1qf4YA.text: Enjoyed my first time here. The staffs are friendly. Even though they are really short and tht the wait is a little longer. They are very straight forward w/ it. They also kept apologizing for the wait. The food is superb love the  beef tataki Will def come back.

uRU-KwsYtowUNw8S0tbhiA.text: Super awesome lunch specials!  Huge portions, very good food.  Most of us got the lunch specials and they were very yummy with lots of food - salad, miso, rice, tempura and an entree!  Yes, AND an entree.  One of us got the teriyaki bowl and it was huge for the price.  Great service and we were back to the office in an hour.  We will be back!

_KxRAPCpO7BQdZpQoda0iA.text: Let me start off by saying that this place was my mom's #1 place to go. Food was great, service was even better. Today we go and this place has taken a 180 turn. I ordered the pork katsu combination with a rapponggi roll and mom ordered the chirashi combination lunch. I was finished with my lunch by the time my mom's came out. My roll never showed up. When I asked about it the waitress lied and said the sushi chef was half way finished making it. 10 minutes later, we asked again and the waitress and waiter started mumbling and disappeared.  Neither one came back to our table to even refill our drinks. When I asked the sushi chef about my order,  he said he was just starting to make it. I told him to not make it and to make sure the roll was off my check. The waiter finally brought the check but he was so rude that he just threw the check on the table. He then kept telling me that our TO GO order was ready but wouldn't hand it to me. Basically, the wait for food and GOOD SERVICE took longer than eating because #1 we never got GOOD SERVICE and the food was just eh.  The original KYARA Group were so sweet and great! Either train these newbie servers better or hire better people.

6UtplRjKY6pi338xESPg_w.text: Wow talk about power lunch! I thought E. Milos had a good deal with their $20.12 lunch menu, but I had an amazing meal here for $8.95! My friend and I visited Kyara as we usually treat each other to lunch and today were here treat, she got off easy! I ordered the spicy salmon bowl, the rice was perfect and the salmon was fresh, this also came with another bowl of rice, soup, salad and tempura. My friend ordered the combination nigiri that came with the same accompaniments, she enjoyed hers as well and commented how fresh the fish was. My only gripe is they don't have brewed iced tea :( but that won't stop me from coming back, I need to try the rest of the menu.

XCFCR1Ymf1zD6JfTmRl0hA.text: Good food, but depending on the day, u never know what kind of service you're gonna get.  I'll keep coming back though. Love the butter squid, grilled veggie skewers, & the CK ponzu is fantastic according to the Hubby. They don't serve the tapas menu at lunch, so be warned. Go for dinner!

n1WHHNjbaF_ZdWns_6c6mQ.text: Expectations can be a blessing, or a curse. Sometimes it helps to whet the appetite and build excitement before an epic experience. Other times it can drain the flavor of the moment as reality falls short of an unreasonable ideal.  For Kyara, I had started with Yelp (of course) and noted the many wonderful reviews and recommendations. I saw that this was frequently visited by the Yelp Elite and they had collectively given it high marks. This evening fell short of that mark.  The atmosphere was wonderful. Clean and efficiently appointed with special extras like the small bamboo spice containers on the table. Service was also quite good. Attentive, but not invasive, willing to make suggestions and help guide our choices.  But ultimately, it simply must come down to the food, the singular reason for spending your hard earned money to have someone else prepare your meal. We had three experienced diners on a journey through the menu. We tried several items and found some stand-out selections that delighted our senses. But alas, we also had several items that fell short of gastronomic bliss.  Some of the stand out dishes included the Kaisen Chawanmushi (seafood custard) which was creamy and beautifully infused with shrimp flavor, and the Yuzu Chili Salmon with equal balance of acidity, spice and lovely salmon flavor. The dishes that had challenges included the Kawa (chicken skin) and Butabara (tongue) which both lacked flavor and left me wanting.  The overall experience to price ratio was decent, with several dishes and hearty man sized appetites we spent about $70 per person. I could try it again, but I would be selective on the dishes I tried.

EFBlr5fq35p5Ureah9zMbQ.text: I was excited to try this place because of all the yelp reviews but according to the waitress there isn't any vegetarian options on the menu....WEIRD??

t0bJ-qs-GVwQYcKYaG9K3w.text: A-OK. Wasn't blown away but the food is good. The costs added up quickly. The free special appetizer was funny because it was just a mini cheese triangle that was sort of heated. Ika butter is good.

y4mkkjdfDPC3VOEB3CSwqg.text: Favorite restaurant in Las Vegas! That's because I can't get enough of Japanese food!  Been here over a dozen times and absolutely love this place. Its a Japanese izakaya style restaurant which means a Japanese bar with food. They serve tapas which are small appetizer portions of food to share amongst one another. They have a great selection of sake and shochu (Japanese Vodka). The staff can be very helpful in finding the perfect one for you! Food is delectable! Service is wonderful when they aren't crazy busy. Would suggest a reservation just in case they get a sudden rush out of the blue.   Favorites: #1 Asahi Draft (amber) mixed with Asahi Kuronama (black) bottled beer from Japan  #2 Maybe a bottle of sake like their Shimizu No Mai or Dewazakura Oka for one to two. Dassai, Shimeharitsu Jun, or Yoshinogawa for groups of 3 or more. If you really want to have fun try their Japanese Whiskey-Yamazaki 12yr or 18 yr.  #3 Hamachi Jalapeno (Sliced raw yellowtail with jalapeno, garlic paste, sriracha, and yuzu ponzu).  #4 Maguro Carpaccio (Sliced raw tuna with homemade garlic chips, garlic mayo, and garlic ponzu).  #5 Wafu Caesars Salad (Japanese style Caesars salad)  #6 Kushi Mori (7 different types of skewers) Includes: the all time fav Butabara kushi (pork belly).  #7 Ika Geso Age (deep fried squid legs) They run out quickly of this one :(  #8 Nasu Dengaku (Deep fried eggplant with spicy miso meat sauce)   #10 Pork Kimchee (Stir fried pork with kimchee) All time fav!  #11 Chicken Garlic Ponzu (Stir fried Chicken with garlic ponzu sauce)  #12 Ika Butter (Stir fried squid rings in butter)  #11 Gyutan Stew (Tender Beef Tongue with gravy sauce and veggies)  #13Tori Meshi (Ground chicken with veggies on top of a rice bowl)  #14 Maguro Zuke Don (Marinated tuna usually raw on top of a sushi rice bowl)  #15 Chocolate Fondant with Vanilla Ice Cream and/or Green Tea Waffle with    Vanilla Ice Cream, honey, and butter.  *P.S. Do not forget to order a bowl or two of their white rice! Sorry no brown. They use an ultra premium rice that I can not resist even on a diet!   Writing all of this makes me want to go right now! I can still make it before they close and it is now 1 am. :)

N1lY8nKcnj6pXo-nZ2EN1g.text: We were lucky to have found a great izakaya on our trip.  Sake collection is very decent and one of the best I saw in US.  I also enjoyed the Japanese hospitality.  Every food was delicious.  I never had taro root pancake, and it was the highlight in the night.  The grated taro was cooked on iron plate.  This is the tepanyaki you will find in Japan. The dough and soy sauce were browned on the pan.  Very creative dishes are nicely mixed in the series of traditional menu list.

m7ng9QnTpIDarZEBy6pSzQ.text: Just had dinner.  Nice atmosphere, great service AND off course, tasty food!  I'm originally from Tokyo and live in LA.  I wish I had a place like this in my neighborhood.  Pretty reasonable, too.

i4kaHn42MKXVPGvqzjDFew.text: I wouldn't say this is authentic japnanese, the waiters and the cooks werent japanese they were korean. But i still love the food. They had amazing tapas. the presentation and the ambiance was way cool too! If you wanted to entertain a guest and impress them in a down to earth athmosphere Kyara is the place to go! The only problem was as the place got busy the waiters started to pay less and less attention to your table, but not a big deal if your there just to relax and chat with your guest!

jU-6qLbu2zCZMWjZZxVgwA.text: Kyara is in the same parking lot as Tropical Smoothie and Sierra Gold. Come before you get too hungry because the wait can be long.   Some people say this place is better than Ichiza. That is a lie. Kyara is still good, just not get-42-demerits-from-the-Health-District-and-still-go-there good like Ichiza. I say that because I wasn't exploding full like I am after Ichiza. Besides, Ichiza's menu is way bigger. Also Ichiza is like a warm hang out with people sitting near you and everybody is drinking pitchers of beer. I've been to Ichiza for many memorable life events. Kyara is a place to have a tasteful date: sit up straight, shyly look up at each other and talk quietly. Enough about this.  Eat these: Hirame no Oba Age: The all knowing deep-fryer united cheese and fish. Submit yourself and make sure no one can see the spit dripping from your mouth as you wait for the dish to cool. Koro Koro Steak: One of the more portion-satisfying dishes, you will enjoy every bite. Ensure you eat everything that comes with it. The flavor combination is great. The meat is finely cooked. Kawa Kushi: chicken skin skewer melts in your mouth. Chicken skin is my weakness. Butabara: pork belly. It was charred and delicious. Enoki Bacon: The stringy mushrooms aren't much for dignified eating, but this was an umami delight, very savory. Gyutan: Beef tongue, thinly cut and cooked well. The meat is tender, drippy and not disturbed by seasonings. Maccha Affogato: who cares if it's plain vanilla ice cream from the plastic tub? They smother it in hot green tea syrup and cold green tea syrup. So good. Green Tea Waffle: Green tea waffles-wow! But what makes this a killer combo is honey. This dish could battle the honey toast at Ichiza.  I would eat a big lunch then come here for dinner and drinks. They have their own beer here. Which is cool if you want a unique check-in on your untappd.

Ru-vN8a2SIBveTKb0tO58Q.text: As soon as we step inside the restaurant , we are back to Japan. Happy place!

PXlFghglOtoNGoE51wbu-Q.text: Kyara is hands down my favorite place to eat in Vegas. There, I've said it. In my opinion, this izakaya tops other similar establishments with their combination of quality food, friendly service, authenticity and affordability. Love the casual-yet-cozy ambience of this place with the smell of meats perpetually cooking on the grill. Great meals for lunch, date night or late night.   I have not seen a better presentation of a sashimi lunch special in any other restaurant, especially at such a low price point. I come here often and crave the same things on their menu. Ika butter, tontoro pork (cheeks) skewers, beef intestine skewers, cheese tempura, pork fried rice, mochi bacon, green tea waffle and the list goes on. It's one of the best collections of Japanese comfort food under one roof. They often have specials such as salmon belly and fresh uni. They also serve rolls made popular by their sister restaurant, Naked Fish. With rolls like the GTR, it's enough to turn a nigiri/sashimi purist like me into a convert.

ZR69PPaABf6cHST1ABm4Vw.text: I love coming to kyara! They always have nice service and their food is bombbbbbb. Whenever I want to drink, this is the first place I come to. The only downside is that there's a wait sometimes because it is a little small compared to other places but that doesn't bother me at all. Their halibut is a must tryyy

tTHcYpGj-Z2AAPjx0btnLg.text: I like the Decor and it's cool to sit at the bar so you can see them cooking in front of you. Everything taste sooooo good! I love cheese tempura. All their skews are good!! It's a Japanese tapas so everything is small and priced from $1.50 - $8. It seem cheap but not really because you usually order more than 5 item to get full.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7wb38opn_VNqbM1kbmTiAQ.text: Thank you Bryan  you are the best food server in town and thanks Rumi  that recommend sardine sushi it's very delicious love it . Kyara is my favorites for Japanese food it's so variety. don't go to any sushi restaurant!!!  only kyara & ask for Bryan

Uxf4UPS1Hu4Qgsw8N4bFkQ.text: If there is anything I love most, it would be Japanese food and so I am very picky with the quality of food and service. Kyara has been open for a while and is very popular as a local spot in Vegas. I have been here a few times just to try out their service and quality of food from an unbiased perspective. Unfortunately, every time I come here, I have the same outlook. It's just "OK" and nothing more.  Service: I think the most important thing in the food and beverage industry is service. You can have the worst food on the menu, but if service is amazing and you get treated well, it can counterbalance that (to some degree, of course). I would rate their service 3/5. I have been here a few times and I get the same service. I usually would have to get someone's attention a few times before I get a refill or whatever it may be. I never get the same consistency and it gets frustrating at times.  Quality/Price of Food: The quality of food varies. They have great fish overall, you can tell that the majority of their items are fresh. They have an array of cold and hot dishes, typical of what you would see in a Japanese tapas spot. However, I do not agree with the price. It is a bit expensive for Japanese tapas. There are other Japanese tapas I have been to in Las Vegas, New York, Miami and Los Angeles where it has been cheaper. The last time I went, I had barely ordered dishes, and the price I paid was way more than I thought it would be.  Ambiance: The restaurant and the decor itself is very clean and cute. The location is great, as well! For an off the strip restaurant, I think they have a great location right off of Jones and 215! I do like how the restaurant is kept clean and simple.  Overall, this is not my first choice of Japanese tapas and there is nothing that really stands out on the menu.

t0b1DX30k75wcyaY9PhPpg.text: We love this place! Great food, great ambiance. We come here for all of our important celebrations with our kids. Brian is one of our favorite people, exceptional service and great personality. We, literally come here once a week. 5 Star all around!

km_Fed83-xrciQ43uSx9uA.text: Great late night option in west Las Vegas. Late night happy hour. Exciting izakaya environment. Good crowd.

aQyXBbqJaaHmF3wXJ5FuIQ.text: It's been a LONG time since I was last here and those times it was for dinner. First time coming for lunch.  Got the lunch special, spicy salmon. You get: tempura, miso soup, salad, and your item. For about $10, what I got was super worth it. I don't eat much at once as it is so the portion size was pretty perfect for me.  Check in on yelp for an extra something. You could get a cocktail item or ice cream as your dessert item.  Never had a problem with their service. It was just hard to understand my server so I just nodded along and that's how I found out my check-in item was ice cream :b. The table next to me, the guy asked about the types of beer they had and he couldn't understand the server at all so he ended up ordering water, haha.  Overall, the location is great for me and I will be back for brunch once again :0).

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy salmon lunch special

iEOxjRlm6XH5BEu98_7CdA.text: Ran across this jewel thanks to yelp. Parking was a breeze to find and the interior is eye appealing.  I started off with hot green tea and ordered the Sashimi lunch combo - a bargain at $10.95 The sides arrived first - miso soup, salad, tempura and all was delish. The tempura included 2 pcs of shrimp. The sashimi arrived and was presented beautifully on a bed of ice and was so fresh.  The service was friendly and so accommodating. I'll definitely be returning here again!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi lunch
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sides for sashimi lunch

B9rkd3M8bO2ABLnSOuKPrw.text: Amazing food at amazing prices!  We tried the mackerel to start followed by pork belly, shiitake, enoki bacon, squid, shrimp, and sauteed garlic squid.    Our favorite was the sauteed garlic squid.  It came with asparagus and an amazing lemon garlic sauce. We wanted to get some sake and our waiter pointed out that they had a cherry blossom sake on the menu for spring.  The sake had a great sweet note that wasn't too overpowering.    Service was amazing and very attentive.  Our waiter was always willing to answer any questions we had and offer up suggestions if we asked.    We could not believe how affordable this place was considering the quality of the food.  We will be adding this to our list of go to places.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Just a sample of what we tried. Cherry blossom sake was the best!
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mackerel appetizer
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sautéed squid

plWPxay6TD1Sahs6i0FS9g.text: Went here for a few drinks and tapas with because Roger T was being a punk...and some were dandruff FLAKES!  The place is rather small but it was nice and clean.    We were given a Japanese slaw while waiting for our food.  We pretty much ordered 2 of each item on the menu: sasami, tomato caprese, ika butter, ham katsu, tori kara-age, koro koro steak, beef tataki, chawanmushi, enoki bacon, mochi bacon, asparagus bacon, butabara kushi, hamachi jalapeno, grilled veggies, aburi shime saba (mackerel), skewers (chicken, pork and wings), green tea waffle, and matcha affogato.  The price wasn't bad.  We ended up paying $180 for 3 people and we ordered a lot of food.  The girls I was with gave up so I had to clean up the mess we started.  My favorites were anything with bacon, koro koro steak (so tender), green tea waffle combined with the matcha affogato.  Delish!!!   The service was excellent. I find no reason not to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus bacon
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken, pork and chicken wing skewers
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Koro koro steak

VixejtOFW5WBFfuvM97bjw.text: I've been here 3 times, two times were for dinner and 1 time for happy hour. I was most impressed with happy hour. We paid 10.95 each and got the 5 piece nigiri with 2 piece shrimp and mixed veg tempura with salad and rice. I think that's a nice deal for lunch. Hubby got the pork katsu and liked it.   Dinner-both times we had a LONG wait. I mean about an hour. I don't think it is that great to have an hour wait. One time we wanted their fresh tofu and they only make it on the hour, that was annoying because we already waited, how long do you want us to wait for some fresh tofu? So we did not get it. It is a 2 hour plus meal. Very slow paced, so plan to spend some time here.   Blue cheese potato salad-I think the original would be better. Quite a strong blue cheese taste. I was happy with all the skewers I tried.   I did not like the yaki onigiri- a huge ball of burnt rice with very little salmon. Not what I pictured in my mind.   I plan on coming back for lunch specials, but I would not go out of my way for dinner unless I have a lot of time on my hands and was not that hungry and could wait.

Eyotw3pKjrlPB3E8M7hAzg.text: Really enjoyed this place! Authentic Japanese tapas, the skewers were my favorite. It was a little on the pricey side for a dinner for two, but that was because my boyfriend and I kept ordering more and more food and we couldn't stop! They also had a wide range of menu items and some really unique ingredients. Service was good, our waiter was very friendly and attentive considering how busy they were as well. I will be coming back to this place for more!!!

SktuS5iM1hfJKEuFVKeCSQ.text: Great tapas kirin draft pitcher $10, happy hour menu is super lit. Oh my god those pork cheeks tapas, get it just salted. Rumy and Bryan top notch servers for real. Spicy tuna bowl. Mouth water AF get it with the gyoza sauce telling you guys. If you sit at the bar you can watch the chefs put in work. And my dudes clientele here a lot of girls haha

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Qt2s74KbRIoUwRzazRC4Fg.text: I'm new to the term "Izakaya" which originated from sake shops that allowed customers to drink in their establishment.  There's an open kitchen with bar seating all around and I believe 4 sets of semi-private tables.  The menu consists of mostly cooked foods, with limited sushi items on the last page and separate added menus of monthly specials, most popular dishes (both with pictures) and a sushi roll menu.  What I noticed first was the seasonings on the table (see picture.)  This was my first Kyara lesson.  In addition to the standard salt, pepper and soy sauce, there was an additional shaker of spice (ichimi - ground chili pepper) and two special containers one filled with what our server could only describe as seasoning she likes on the skewers (sansho - which I googled to find out that it is a plant in which you pulverize the berries to make this pepper)  and the other was seven different spices (shichimi - which sansho is one of the main peppers, orange peel, black and white sesame seeds, hemp seed, ground ginger, and seaweed) which was incredibly yummy on everything.    When I went to my trusty yelp app I noticed there was a check in offer for a free appetizer.  Come to find out they've changed it to a free dessert - however I'm not a "sweets" person and asked if I could have a miso soup instead and they accommodated.  Yay!  Unfortunately, it was very mildly flavored and  not as hot as I would have preferred.  Boo!  I ordered the shiitake mushrooms $1.50 each, shishito peppers $1.50 each (picture is of two orders) pork belly $2.50, chicken gizzard $2.50, deep fried squid $3.80, octopus, halibut and albacore nigiri $4 each.  The mushrooms, peppers and pork belly were delicious.  All cooked perfectly.  The pork belly had just enough fat to balance the flavor and was juicy.  The gizzard was ok and the squid was a little on the dry side.  Although the squid came with lemon, and wasn't greasy, it needed something.  I was thinking of maybe a sauce to dip in but they didn't really have anything.  The sushi was ok.  Not the best quality but I should have expected this as sushi is not what they're known for.  So many other things I wanted to try so I'll definitely come back.  (Especially to try the gyutan stew - beef tongue $12.)  Service was excellent and Soichiro was delightful and extremely helpful and patient with all my questions.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Octopus, halibut and albacore $4 each
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deep fried squid $3.80
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shishito peppers $1.50 each (2 orders) and shiitake mushrooms $1.50 each

pqSClomF2ZMNvtVNdD-s5w.text: I have eaten here several times. The food here is good, but the service is something that needs work on EXTREMELY BAD. Since we got sat it took them about 15mins to get us water, we were never greeted by our server. I had to stand up and ask for us to get served water and to get our order taken. The person that took our orders wasn't that nice either, a bit rude if you asked me.  Since being here for almost 30mins I have seen 3 groups of people come In after us, get their food and leave. While we haven't gotten our food or got checked up on. It was busy but nothing crazy. Even if they were backed up they should have touched the table and made us aware of it. Finally after 35mins later, the food arrived BUT unfortunately my order was wrong. Probably due to the fact that the person who took our order didn't write it down. The first guy that dropped of the food didn't even say sorry to me for messing up my order, shame.  Another thing was that on yelp there is a advertisement for 1 free special app, we asked about it. But they told us it was only for dinner. If it's for dinner only, then I think it should state that on the advertisement.   The ENTIRE time we we're there not once did we get checked up on. It was the worse experience I ever had. All in all, I love the food here, it's what I come back for. Service on the other hand really disappoints, it's sad for a place like this. My suggestion servers/hosts Please pay attention to your customers more. I'm super good on leaving tips too, but not this time. No service no tip..sorry. I sure hope the next time I come there's better service.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy tuna bowl lunch bento special

DC5CU2TeIHIYeHjVmYiL2g.text: Very authentic place, they serve more homemade dishes here than other izakaya I've been to in the U.S., such as motsuni-wow.    Quality of sushi is excellent and you can request belly cut.  Almost everyone who works here are Japanese, though service can be confusing at time so if you're doing English stick with English, don't mix Japanese and English together even if you have a native speaker lol  Definitely recommend to anyone who wants good authentic sushi and Japanese dishes.  By far beats all the so call high end Japanese restaurants on the strip that modernize sushi so much it comes out and tastes like a project while burning your wallet.  Save your money at the card table instead!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi large with salmon subs.  Delicious fresh cuts!!!!

rV3ZHyGbr6e8k0Lw82ZwlA.text: Moved to Vegas just over a month ago. Everywhere Ive been has been very good/excellent Guess lucky streak had to come to an end. This place is horrible, don't know how it's so highly rated. Maybe dinner is totally different but this lunch was a waste of time and money.  First of all ordered glass of red wine, few minutes later came back with white. Told them ordered red, looked at me and went to change it. 5 minutes later came back and said they were out, only $13 glass available. So ordered it. Tasted like box wine, except boxed wine is actually better. Long story short, order 2 lunch boxes and a side of GRILLED chicken. One box came first, then 5 minutes later chicken came  except was not grilled, Fried to a crisp!! Totally inedible. Then after everything was finished, the mackerel for the other box came.  Unbelievably bad. Maybe dinner is different , but won't risk it, Soooooo many other good/great places to go. Negative stars.... Don't trust the pictures. Also I think maybe everyone was too busy in the kitchen talking that food was all burned to a crisp.

1iDLQ_ljh24vhSusCFzlKg.text: This place was recommended to me by a random stranger at a bar. Once I looked up the Yelp reviews, I went in that same night. What can I say, patience is for losers.  HH specials from 10-1AM. Location decor is nice, the cozy nooks allow for some privacy for dining with friends or a date. Service is attentive without constantly stopping by the table, which again lends itself to a more private meal.  POTATO SALAD WITH BLEU CHEESE: Creamy texture, cheesy taste, what's not to love about this? Simple but tasty. Ate it too fast to get a pic. GOBO CHIPS: Not clear what these are made out of, but they're crunchy and light and have a good flavor, seasoned lightly with furikake. TEKKA ROLL: Pretty standard, would stick to sashimi here. FRIED GARLIC POTATOES: More potatoes? Yes, they're tasty. Garlic taste isn't too overwhelming but it paired well with the sauce from the next dish... BABY SQUID STIR FRIED IN GARLIC: Hands down the best dish. I'd eat a whole trough of this on my hands and knees, it's that good. Garlicky sauce, tender squid babies, and green onion. So, so good. ABURI SABA: Can't go wrong with mackerel, didn't care for the acidic dipping sauce it was paired with. SALMON DON: bowl of sushi rice topped with salmon sashimi. Salmon was good, portion of rice was a bit much. TOMATO BACON: if you love BLTs, you'll love this. Not particularly unique but love the taste, I get this often. TEMPURA CHEESE: Now THIS surprised me. Tempura mozzarella, havarti, and brie. The portion of fig jam could have been more generous, it was barely a single bite. Dish wa still good. SALMON SASHIMI: Quality of fish in the don was so good we just asked for an additional order of sashimi. For $11, it's a steal. So fresh and delicious, just dip slightly in soy sauce and enjoy.  Don't forget to use your Yelp check-in offer for a free appetizer. Beers and wines are half off during HH, and the house Cab is actually pretty good quality. Menu is extensive, but most everything was really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon sashimi
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tempura cheese
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The aftermath

xes6Q-2PjM4rSWlUcZXoAg.text: I lived in Japan for three years so I'm always looking for restaurants to take me back. And I found it!  I got the (and I'm paraphrasing the names here) salmon salad, chicken rice bowl, and the special hamburger steak! I'll attach pictures bc I forgot to write down the actual names of it...  My friend and I also got a free dessert because we checked in! It's so bomb. It's like vanilla ice cream with a green tea drizzle on it. SO good.   The staff was friendly, the food was delicious, and the atmosphere felt classy. I'm sure it can get pricey if you come here when you're really hungry, but if you're just looking for good tasting food then you've found it!  Aaaaaah. Natsukashi. (:

Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken!
