XTr0rJKd1mq5u23VyJQYDA.text: Excellent service this time! The food was amazing, especially enjoyed the cheese tempura again.  We also enjoyed the takoyaki, better than any we've had in vegas. The chef sent over a lovely free dessert afterwards.

_l-VWl6w-_0LQqLF7jYAIg.text: My preferred place for robatayaki in town.  Better pricing and flavor than raku.  Service is friendly and fast, food is ultra tasty.    The kiddos really enjoy this place due to the fact that skewered food is novel!

WmlGi4tsi2Ti325kY6lC5Q.text: This is a good choice for lunch but I'll have to admit, it appears that dinner time is the real time to come and try out the star players on the menu! With that said, this is only a review of their lunch but I am eagerly awaiting my next visit to try their other menu items.   Nice and easy location to get to right off the interstate which was a bonus. It can get super busy inside so squeezing a quick lunch within an hour's time. The place was so busy we had to sit at the sushi bar to eat curry. Not a bad thing, but I felt so guilty taking up precious sushi bar space!! lol  The downside of eating at the sushi bar was that I got to see how they made the curry:  1. They take a bowl from the freezer.  2. They take the top off and open said bowl.  3. Place in microwave.  4. Plate up rice while curry is being nuked. 5. Dump curry from bowl onto rice.   The upside of watching the cooking process, you hope that it's homemade curry they cooked and froze in advance to make it easier for the customers to enjoy. :) It certainly was just as tasty as the curry I make at home. Not the worst, but also not the best. Just a solid choice for curry.  You can add chicken Katsu for a small price more and it's a well rounded meal. Overall, good place for lunch and a definite add to the list of lunching options. :)

SnKFYOc19djuABCkBHodFQ.text: I have now found the best Japanese tapas/izakaya place in Vegas! I used to go to Ichiza all the time and was a big fan, but since there is always a wait there, I found myself at Kyara. This is definitely a hidden gem (which after word gets out may no longer be) that I have been going to more and more lately. Currently $2 happy hour beers to go with a variety of delicious small plates that you can share with everyone.   Some of my favorite dishes include: Hamachi jalapeno Age dashi Nasu (eggplant) Sauteed clams with sake Ika Butter (squid) pork kimchee koro koro steak gyutan skewers (beef tongue) chocolate fondant (basically a warm chocolate cake)  This is definitely one of my new favorite places to bring my friends that are visiting. So far, everyone has enjoyed this place and we will definitely be back again to try some of the other dishes.

PH3svj6gUD-JZaaisE5brg.text: Slower than constipated poop. Jesus waited there in the waiting room for 30 minutes when half the restaurant was empty. Food was good but that was trumped by my suffering of my belly starving for food. Made me wait so long, my stomach acid burned a hole in my stomach lining. I'm renaming this place "Tapas for Turtles"

y9vFu6KJCxopqvslcETajA.text: Yum. Really yummy food and it's open late too! Staff is super sweet and welcoming and the menu is enormous.

Mf6-DGc1qMPdZdRJJuLhBw.text: The intestines were very disappointing. Chewy though it did have okay flavor. Everything was just passable but very pricey. Raku is still the best IF you can get a reservation while visiting Las Vegas.

fEU20Z79hBfWMAP7zGtd9Q.text: They don't do 'To Go' orders.  No explanation. Foods looks good but this seems strange. Maybe it is because they want their food portrayed in the optimal light. I can understand that but at least explain!

QeBbY7U5lqNgXxR69Vjf3Q.text: Been here plenty of times, always a great experience. Service is always fast and with a smile. Love the thats its open late.

CLQaqaVv_It5Pke_ha0pag.text: I can not believe I forgot to write a review! My husband and I came here for date night last week. This is actually a place we are wanting to return to. We usually go somewhere new every date but never have the urge to return anywhere. Until here, anyway. The price was great considered how much we ate. We ordered some sashimi, a side of rice, some cold soba (I love soba!), some sort of ramen with pork and vegetable that was on the specials list for the month which was actually quite tasty, some garlic squid, and the deja vu roll. It was enough to fill us up and we eat A LOT. The service was fine. The server was very informative and confident when speaking to us. We had to ask for the rice more than 2 times, but other than that the service was good. We assumed that maybe the rice was cooking when we had asked, but the servers did not want to let us know for whatever reason. I reccomend this place. It is small, but really good.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband pigging out.

m_N3EobjwSLIjCCmwlIJ2A.text: Kyara Japanese Tapas has some good grilled items. Everything from ambiance to service to food was satisfying. It is a fun and clean environment to be in while dining. I enjoyed the mini udon, the koro koro steak, the kushi mori, and the agedashi tofu.   The tofu used for the agedashi tofu wasn't from anywhere special, but it was good. The koro koro steak was very tender. The kushi mori was okay. Mini udon was flavorful and the broth was pretty yummy.   Service is ok. The server expects you to move things aside to make room for the next dish. Water is always filled.   Sit at the counter and you'll be able to see their open kitchen and their workers at work, cooking your delicious meal.   I would come back again if it were closer to me. If I'm in the area, I'll definitely be in.

08sd-ych4xIxvvAVAKbK9w.text: The food is very delicious and the portions are very generous.  I love having the chicken teriyaki.  The shrimp tempura, white rice, and side salad all come complimentary with your order.  The only reason I didn't give a five star review is because they wouldn't honor the Yelp check-in offer.  However the deliciousness of the food far makes up for the un-honored offer.  I will be back!

mRkrj7fFv2dVVth0tCHzyA.text: Good variety of dishes. Go for dinner to discover the real creative and tasty items. Lunch is a great deal, but is a limited and standard menu.  Highlights: Deep-fried tofu is fresh, silky smooth and soaks in a strong and savory sauce Hamachi Jalapeno and Maguro Carupaccio provide a nice kick of spice Tsukune with and without sauce Shitaake Pork Kimchee  We also got a few pieces of nigiri hamachi and it was like buttuh. It's nice to have a sushi-ish restaurant in the SW that serves quality fish and a has skilled kitchen. Service was not too stellar, as our waiter disappeared for a long time. Will likely sit at the sushi bar next time.

blClQGBL1rw1Zp0hFGAZkQ.text: We love it the crew is awesome! Amazing Japanese Tapas the staff are awesome my family love it!!!

bVf7ZjuR7Jz_K5NxqrL1QQ.text: My top choice for Japanese tapas in town.  Good service and ambience.  Considering Japanese Tapas is never a cheap option for dinner if you want to stuff yourself,  the prices at Kyara were reasonable.  My favorites: Koro koro steak, Age dashi tofu, beef tongue stew.

aZC_cN0P-SkHeVlI56VZZQ.text: Best Japanese bang for your buck in town.  Great lunch special: tempura is not over breaded, sashimi is nice and fresh and serviced on ice.  Only thing I would fault is the lack of fresh wasabi.. but then again I do not think I have ever seen that in Vegas.  Overall, excellent!

0KIOl5dvenJ1melMM6zrLg.text: First off, how customer service is so friendly, I love that.  Vegas needs more of that.  I sat at the bar, and I ordered 4 items from kushi (chicken with onion, a wing, enoki wrapped with bacon, and the best the tsukune (chicken w/ pork).  I ordered without sauce, just salt, but I have heard the sauces are great as well with the skewers.  From the specials I got a spinach salad with beef.  I could totally go for that right now.  Beef was very tender.  And finally I had a mini bowl of udon soup.  Perfect size for someone who wants to eat other things with the soup as opposed to ordering a big bowl.  The prices stand out here, they are not high.  Definitely cheaper than the other places in Vegas.  It's a great spot to introduce many different tastes to the palate.  Domo arigato!!

iybe9FfefuZ4b-Vtxxd7wA.text: I'm so mad!!! We just left this stupid restaurant. Although I'm upset, I'm not going to exaggerate about our bad experience one bit. My daughter and I got there at 12:32pm for a lunch date with my hubby/her daddy.  We got there before my hubby, so we can get a table and order, so the food will be delivered before/when my hubby arrives(since Hubby's lunch break is only an hour). The guy(Hispanic, tall, I guess is also the person in charge cuz I asked to speak to the manager, and he said he was in charge) at the front asked how many people, I replied, "Three, and we can sit anywhere." He said, "We're cleaning up a table right now, so it'll only be a few mins."  We still haven't gotten seated when my hubby arrived at 12:45pm. We still patiently waited until 1:07pm. Then, I approached someone and told them, "We've waited for over 30 mins when we were told it'll only be a few mins to get seated."  Then the guy who told me that walked by, and I asked him, "Why did you tell me it'll only be a few minutes when it's been 35 mins, and we still haven't gotten seated? That's very inconsiderate and unprofessional of you. If you had told me it'll be that much longer, we would've maybe gone somewhere else."  I then asked to speak to a manager, and he replied, "He's not here right now, and I'm in charge." Then I said, "Wow, you had us waiting this long, and we didn't even get an apology? Instead, you're going to try to make excuses(he said he didn't want to seat us at the bar because we had my 3yo daughter)."  I added, "Then why did you tell me you guys were cleaning up a table for us." We just decided to leave.  My hubby ended up missing lunch! Thanks for ruining our lunch date, IDIOTS!!!   My friends and I ate here for the first time 2 weeks ago, and they lacked service.  But I wanted to give them another try since they're literally 2 mins away from my house. NEVER AGAIN!!!!! (Wish SOHO was still open for lunch:( )

60571H_OwAKXnjFo8CP6mA.text: Oooo---ha--you gooooooooo-zaimasu! Thanks for being so wonderful! This is my favorite izakaya. Kyara is baby-friendly. That's important to know because not many restaurants are baby-friendly. The booths are spacious and rooms are divided so Max (my baby) can't bother that many people. I especially like checking off the items I want a-la San Francisco Dim Sum style. I tend to over order because of my appetite so it helps to see things written down and realize all that food can't fit into this body.   The stars of the night are the two sashimi dishes in the appetizers section and the teriyaki sauce. I can pour that sauce on anything and it'd elevate the dish to the next level. Similar to a well-aged balsamic vinegar. So make sure you order the meat skewers with sauce and vegetable salted with sauce on the side.    Great food, great service great ambiance. WIN WIN WIN!

khB7MXL66BVndTIc6qVdzg.text: Good food, but man the wait sucks. What are they creating the waffle batter from scratch?!

KANblbyOH9STxv0JeAW43Q.text: Ate here long long time ago, and did not visit again till recently, and wanna to go back so bad afterwards. Very impressed by the soft tofu dish they freshly make every hour, pork belly skewer was so good, and also salmon rice bowl. Did not realy like the rice oniegri. But, overall, everything else we had was very good!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Not a good fit to my taste, but if you like crispy and grilled flavor, give it a try!
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fried cheese plate, interesting concept, taste okay!
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Try it if you like something light and refreshing!

dxP9XnxyDqSGV58tIXEmQQ.text: Maybe my new favorite restaurant in Vegas.  Served tapas style, my wife and I went crazy here.  Personal favorites were the yellowtail sashimi with jalapeno, albacore sashimi, shiitake mushroom kabobs, pork belly kabobs, and shishito peppers, but we liked everything we ordered (the list is so long, I don't remember everything.)  My wife enjoyed her drink (but I think I liked it more than she did) - it was ginger ale with Hibiki (Japanese whiskey.)  Left both of our heads spinning a little, but not to worry - we just hung out and ordered more food until we sobered up :-)  Finished up with the chocolate fondant, which was pretty much a lava cake - VERY good.  A few drinks, over 15 plates to share, dessert, and out the door full and completely satisfied for around $100.  Can't wait to come back and try more of the menu, and get another Hibiki drink!

9l-xPkwkIwD67qXJXbQlHg.text: Finally popped my Kyara Izakaya cherry, and..... IT WAS AMAZING! A friend of mine had been telling me about this place for a few months now and last night I finally went. I made reservations at about 7pm for an 8pm dinner for three and noted a birthday celebration. We showed up at around 7:50pm behind another group of three, who were promptly asked if they had reservations (no) and they were advised there were no tables available. Right after they were seated at the bar, we were greeted and seated at our table. - Had no issues - **TIP - if you check into yelp or facebook, they are offering a free specialty drink** The food was really good, small portions but that is the style. The Kobe Beef Tataki and the Green Tea Waffles are a must try. All in all I loved this place. The service I received was great and the food was soooo good. If you're interested in reading about the food we tried, I'll have that at the bottom. :] -------------------- The menu wasn't too extensive and I saw a lot of dishes that I hadn't expected such as skewered tomatoes... interesting. We ended up ordering some sake, a Tiger Roll, Garlic Chicken Ponzu, Soft Shell Crab, Kobe Beef Tataki, skewered Chicken Gizzard, Beef Tongue Nabe, Gyu-tan and Hamachi Kama. The first two dishes to come out were the Tiger Roll and the plate of Kobe Beef Takaki. The Tiger Roll (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) was ordered by my bf so I don't know what exactly was in it, but it was pretty good. The Kobe Beef Tataki (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) was my order and WE LOVED IT. If you're not scared of eating meat a little raw I would definitely suggest trying this. It is sooo tender. It also comes with two different dipping sauces - a normal ponzu and a spicy, garlic ponzu. the tray also included some garlic and wasabi as well. - This was easily one of my favorite dishes. We actually ended up ordering a 2nd plate - Then a whole mess of dishes came out, so I don't remember the order exactly. We had the Garlic Chicken Ponzu (yelp.com/user_local_phot...), Soft Shell Crab (no photo, we ate it too fast), Beeg Tongue Nabe (yelp.com/user_local_phot...), Gyu-tan or broiled beef tongue (yelp.com/user_local_phot...), and the Hamachi Kama (yelp.com/user_local_phot...). The Garlic Chicken Ponzu was my bf's favorite. We also ordered another one of those. The Soft Shell crab was like most other soft shell crabs I've had, nothing super special. The Gyu-Tan is broiled beef tongue. It wasn't very flavorful, it was ok. I think Ichiza's skewered Beef Tongue is better. The Beef Tongue Nabe, however, was a delight. It wasn't what I expected at all. Our waitress described it to me as Beef Tongue Hot Pot with veggies. The broth was flavorful but light and the best part was the vegatables had soaked up just enough of each flavor. The potatoes were cooked perfectly, not too raw and hard and not so over cooked it just fell apart. One of the last dishes we ordered was the Asari Sakamushi (steamed clams in sake). It was a nice light dish to finish off dinner. Again, ate it too fast to remember to snap a picture. OOPS. LASTLY, they brought out the Green Tea Waffles with Happy Birthday written on the plate in Green Tea Syrup. (yelp.com/user_local_phot...) IT WAS SOOOO GOOD. If you enjoy Green Tea, you will love this dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea Waffles (birthday dessert)
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gyu-tan (broiled beef tongue)
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hamachi Kama

bG5cV08nfOq6MNQRuFPy3g.text: Oolong Cocktail, Orange Juice Cocktail Yamaimo Somen - Mountain potato somen noodle Cheese no Tempura - Cheese Tempura with Fig Jam Age dashi Mochi - Deep fried Mochi with special sauce Ika Maru - Grilled whole squid Yamaimo Teppan - Mountain potato on hot plate with Ponzu sauce Kaisen Chawanmushi - Steamed Egg Custard with Seafood Kawa - Chicken skin / Butabara - Pork Belly Tofu Mousse - Homemade Vanilla Tofu Mousse, Strawberry Sorbet Green Tea Waffle - Green tea waffles with Vanilla Ice cream, Butter, and Honey  Admittedly a bit perplexed by the subtitle "Japanese Tapas" as opposed to Izakaya, Kyara had been a longtime member of my 'to-visit' list when a friend and I decided to pay them a visit on Saturday evening and arriving just after 7:00pm to a restaurant recently named "Ethnic restaurant of the year" by Desert Companion the first surprise of many that evening was in fact the space itself, devoid of all other diners leaving us a corner seat at the bar and no less than three waiters to cater to our needs.  Featuring an extensive menu of Japanese classics arranged under headings such as grilled, steamed, and fried plus a handful of daily specials as Chef Komada watched over a team of four in the open kitchen it was with an eye toward variety that we placed our order and with a complimentary cocktail to begin nearly every one of our nine items proved excellent, particularly considering a total bill inclusive of tip less than $30 per person.  Starting first with cold selections and then proceeding through those grilled and hot it was with impeccable skill that traditional options like robatayaki, grilled squid, and chawanmushi shined but far more interesting and thus more impressive were items trending toward esoteric, both the hot and cold mountain potato dishes absolute show stoppers in terms of texture and flavor while tempura selections proved innovative and light.  Moving on to dessert, a decision left in my hands, a selection two sweets arrived and while the tofu mousse was admittedly quite light the general lack of flavor proved rather underwhelming in its own regard and all the more so next to a pair of crispy yet supple matcha spiked waffles topped with a hefty scoop of vanilla ice cream and sidecars of liquid butter and honey, the end effect every bit as delicious as the Honey Toast at Ichiza or Serenade but with a slight bitter undertone adding a touch of intrigue, an upgrade on a classic that seems to typify much of the restaurant's cuisine and all the more reason to come back soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Kawa - Chicken skin / Butabara - Pork Belly
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Age dashi Mochi - Deep fried Mochi with special sauce

ixVYuKGZSMp9xlGEK16blw.text: Their lunch bowls are amazing! Do not waste ur time with any of the skewers. They are literally one bit. I would only go back for the lunch bowls.

BpsBYxN-NGMVLR148n-m9Q.text: Love this Japanese tapas (izakaya style) restaurant!  I've been here twice now and both times it wasn't packed so that was nice- no waiting.  The servers are friendly and comes around frequently to fill your water or make sure you're doing okay.   It's a great place to order a little bit of everything and share! Other than the yakitori (skewered chicken) orders, the portions are pretty big. There's a lot to choose from too. But try to order it all in the beginning so you won't have to wait too long.  The korokoro steak is a must order! It's delicious~ I ordered it for myself thinking it was going to be small since it's a tapas place but I was not able to finish it by myself.   They have a good selection on drinks as well!   There's plenty of parking in front of the restaurant!

iHK0ZOvXgVOkVG2Gn8kZ2w.text: Wanting to meet the GF for a mid week date night this was the place to try after searching Yelp for something new to try that would split the journey equally for us to meet.  Kyara is a small and intimate dining establishment.  For mid week it was busy but when a table came available it was quickly cleaned and we were seated.  Having never really tried tapas of any kind, we began to check of numerous items from the menu to hand to the waiter.  Chicken skewers, sushi, salads, soups we tried a little of everything.  I should have been taking notes, but was distracted with conversations and watching what everyone else was doing.  The highlight of the night was when soup was presented to us.  As the waiter kindly explained despite a small language barrier, I made out something that sound like "Don't let smell scare you."  I immediately gave it a sniff but only noticed a sort of earthy aroma emanating from it.  I dived in and began noticing the different textures.  Located within was something that I thought might have been some kind of pickled green bean.  The chunks of meat were a mystery.  Both the GF and I had fun guessing what it might be.  When the waiter returned I made an inquiry  as to what the green thing was as well as the meat.  We were then informed that it was gelatinous seaweed and pork intestines.  GF stopped eating and I went on to finish it. It was different and not bad at all.  It is easy to get lost with checking boxes on the items that look good.  Before we knew it we had an army of small plates and bowls maneuvering all about our table.  Fun place and I would absolutely try it again.

ufBLZS94nylJVxd2wpzfeg.text: Been here several times for lunch. Previous visits have been good, not great. The food is what has me coming back, which is great. The service on the other hand is less than great. Came here for lunch and asked for a high chair before being seated but had to ask again 5 minutes later while we were still waiting for the server to greet us and take our drink order. We finally got our drinks about 12 minutes after being seated. Server was not attentive at all. They were pretty busy but there was very little interaction with him. Our food arrived and we didn't have silverware on our table so we had to ask and wait for them.  Please work on service here. You have a great following and product but lack on the service side

_-43AmcXQuQqE80dX3Gi-w.text: We came at 12 midnight Saturday night and it was busy!  We were starving. I was impatient but the wait was worth it.  place is amazeballs!!! we will definitely come back!

qOzgmhROa6Ocl4W-k-cG5g.text: From my visit a few years ago, to my most recent few visits, their customer service has risen greatly.   They welcome all guests as soon as they walk in, which is much improved.   The food is and has always been good.   They are still on a bit of a pricey side, but it's well worth it to come in, have a drink, and chat with your friends once in a while.  I recommend you call ahead to make sure there are tables available! They kindly put your name down last minute before you head your way (if there is no pre-existing reservation).

uogi0LJghJjE5AqP8dbpbA.text: Had this one on the list for a while and decided go give it a try place is nice and intimate. The sushi was a little to saucy for my taste and the cooked food was way too salty per kieth a. Review. I would not be going there again.

jKUDBMqBWOAzhhl_4boMsQ.text: FYI. they no longer accept the yelp check in any longer.  The food was good, a little cheap on the spicy tuna/salmon bowl. Service wasn't great even though it wasn't packed.

QsuUs8bonob702dmIFMbrQ.text: It doesn't deserve a four or five stars! I found it on yelp and went to try because it had a good review. But the food is very so so. We ordered a salmon sashimi and made us disappointed. The salmon sashimi is something like I can eat in AYCE sushi. Plus, the price is expensive!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3vBxWq_SsU0T91JYM2zmug.text: This place is amazing!  First and foremost, the decor is so cute and minimal, and the set up of the bar and seating is perfect! I went with a few friends/co-workers of mine, and I got to taste a bunch of goodness!   One of the most memorable items was the "Koro Koro steak." The sauce, the tenderness of the meat, the grated radish/garlic on top, with the soybean sprouts to add some texture! PERFECT, in my opinion. The next favorite was the "Jidori Tori Kara" tender & juicy local chicken with a wonderful garlic ponzu sauce! I loved the citrus-y taste it had and the chicken, you could just tell was of high quality.  We also had the "Maguro Carpaccio" and a few of the skewers. EVERYTHING was good. Also, we finished with the chocolate fondue dessert, awesome with the ice cream.   Between the 4 of us the bill was under $50, which is definitely affordable!  I really wanted to try the deep friend mochi, and the agedashi eggplant, but they ran out of eggplant, and my party wasn't as interested in the mochi dish. -sigh- there's always next time!  I will return, and I'm sure I will probably outspend my first visit since I was being polite and not being the pig I usually am! I can't wait.  PS  they are open late! even better!

Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. menu
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. cute little condiments set

GIif4ygvH_vFXD2Uvvw33w.text: I love the chicken ponzu and the mini udon here. It's a very small place but usually no wait. The green tea waffle is amazing to finish the meal.

k113j5zqc_jfJVn1ryZyxw.text: Had an awesome time at Kyara Japanese Tapas. Loved their sauteed edamame and skewers. Great place to come with friends or on a date. Staff is super friendly. Can't wait to try the rest of the menu!

zCo3pNzgYnakXENwUXZftg.text: Traditional Japanese cuisine... beautiful presentation, good ingredients, served with a smile.   Hamachi Kama - fresh, soft, with home-made sauce Seafood egg custard - loaded with seafood, cooked to perfection Sashimi platter - soooo pretty, served on a ice basket w/ bamboo leaves - so artistic  $70 for 2. very reasonable.

42-1fpMjSMOeRRXfAEF6aA.text: ITADAKIMASU!  Ever have that craving for some good yakitori, or a simple bowl of udon noodles unmolested by fancy, modern twists?  Kyara has that, and more.  With it's genuine yakitori grill and simple preparations, their Japanese fare is my favorite in town thus far.  Not only are you transported to a small restaurant in Japan--and I'm not talking Tokyo, but some other well populated city with those restaurant alleys--but the flavors are spot on and bountiful.  The moment you walk in you're greeted by happy servers and chefs.  A simple, clean bar to sit at is the main display, while smaller, private seating areas are available.  I opt for counters every single time.  Why?  Because I take joy in watching chefs prepare food.  From the hand-beaten pots to the fine knife work on vegetables and seafood, it's a show in of itself, and you get to eat it!  I ordered almost everything, from tempura to beef tongue.  We of course order a few things off the small grill, as well as some udon, miso, and the like.  The grilled food is perfect, as you can get it either just salted or sauced.  Both are melt-in-your-mouth yummy, and hot off the grill.  The tempura is crispy, yet light, and what I love about this place is the chopped up radish topped with ginger that they serve with it.  I throw that mountain in to my tempura sauce and have at it.    Despite their yummy grilled foods, the one thing that blew my mind was their base broth for their udon noodles and the miso soup.  I don't know what type of dashi or bonito they use, but the first sip and slurp of the udon made my eyes close and my mouth drool with a wet, udon-y smile.  I was whisked back to the days on the beach eating udon in the early morning, or those after bar dinners at 3am.  Needless to say I tried to stop by the following night for another bowl or two of udon, but they close on Mondays.  Darnit.  Fellow yelpers, foodies, and friends--you must stop in and have a bite here.  It's a great hidden gem in Vegas, and one that, in some ways, I wish we could keep secret. I don't want to share their yummy goodies with anyone else except all of you.  Quietly make your way down to S. Jones & 215.  I'll be the fat chick in the corner slurping on udon, eating some meat on a stick, and chopstick-ing some sashimi.  Gochisosama!

I_0KaLlsM-OYfrSCnQj2wg.text: We showed up for dinner at 6 and was seated fairly promptly.  Turns out their sister establishment was having an anniversary party so they were out of a ton of stuff.  Uh what?  Why don't you prep for this rather than run out of stuff.  Ran out of chawan mushi.  Had to reserve one of the last two tofu mousses.  About half of the things we wanted weren't available.  The Yelp check-in deal is no longer valid. They now offer one of three free drinks for a check-in on any mobile platform (Facebook, Foursquare, etc.). I got the tea version. It was horrible. Tasted like grape cough syrup. No wonder they give it away for free.  Ok now that I've got the bad out of the way.  The chicken skin skewer was very good.  Heck the table next to us ordered like 15 of them.  I imagine that'd be delicious if I didn't think too closely about the fact that I'm eating 15 skewers of chicken skin.  The eggplant and meat sauce was also good, but maybe a bit pricy for what it was (like mabo tofu).  While they might have some good items it was overall a poor experience.  The pork belly was also pretty decent.  They had the aji two ways which was so so.  When it comes two ways it comes as sashimi and nigiri.  They had a nice presentation where the fish skeleton was skewered to look like it was swimming, but they didn't fry it up for us.  It's nice that they have hamachi kama there (I really like the collar bone), but it was a bit overcooked so a bit disappointed.  With all the food around Vegas I think I'm going to explore elsewhere next time.

kQZuGwN-_iNBrM2WfK7GqA.text: I love this restaurant, awesome food!! I just found out they have Japanese server, I like to talk to them!! It's my first time use Japanese in Las Vegas, it's very nice night!!

rCT-SG2YFqB9j3jJS_cuMw.text: Review for lunch specials only. I've been coming here for the last 4 years, mostly lunch specials because it's awesome deals. Even though they're $1 more now than previous years, still a fantastic deal. I love they don't skimp on the tempura by giving you boring veggies. They give you 2 ebi and Japanese yam, sweet potatoes, zucchini and asparagus. The sashimi, sushi or spicy salmon/tuna bowls are all tasty and fresh. Curry rice is a bit boring and small portion, plate and sauce are big but not a whole lot of meat inside. I'd skip ordering curry rice here if given the choice. But only $7 can't have everything I guess.   The tonkatsu is always a winner and we always get a side of it to go with our already filling lunch set w soup, salad, entree and tempura. Hope they never change it.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Curry beef, not much beef.
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Spicy salmon, loads w masago.
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi lunch. Wish pieces are bigger and just a bit more.

8YtagwH9wV5BmyW3AP84dQ.text: Nice ambiance and good food but prices a bit high hence 4 stars.  Service very friendly.

8kUw94CDCqCLJj4_D-lb4g.text: Mmm love that this place is not only open late night, but has late night appetizers. This place never disappoints! Last night was the third time I've been there and amazing.  We ordered the rib eye steak, fish tacos, takoyaki, shishito pepper skewers, unazaki(I think that's the name) and a pitcher of Sapporo.  The rib eye, per my boyfriend, was amazing! Seasoned very well and tender. I like that they already cut it up in bite size pieces. And it came in decent amount on a hot staub. I overheard the people next to us mention how good it smelled which was True! I ended up dipping my shishito peppers in the marinate. The shishito peppers were grilled to perfection, came in threes which was a really good price! The fish tacos was really good. The "shell" was a deep fried circular wonton with raw fish with a few micro herbs and sauce. Each bite was very fresh. The unazaki came on their "eel month" menu. Basically cooked unagi with pickled sweet cucumbers and cooked seaweed. I think all three of those came together very well. And lastly, the takoyaki. Very delicious. I liked that it wasn't steaming hot when it came so I can actually enjoy it without burning my entire mouth. Also came on their happy menu along with the Sapporo! Cheers!  Came out to around $50 dollars, which was about the same price as we would've paid for AYCE sushi(which is what we were deciding against) and we left with happy full stomach!

de2QvUarWv8NZTTmgLIsCw.text: The options are great. Late night happy hour is also very nice. Be been coming here for years. This place still hasn't let me down. It's very consistent.

iqe1S3Kvws8tiqnobIEyNA.text: Kyara definitely is my new favorite place for Japanese tapas in vegas! Very friendly service and amazing food! Love this place!!  Highly recommend to Japanese food lovers!

sKjg54-ywa_GDuqbeXDBZQ.text: The lunch combinations are of good value and are filling.  I usually like to get the spicy salmon or spicy tuna bowl lunch sets.  They come with salad (with really good dressing,) miso soup, and tempura.  The food generally tastes pretty good, but no so much the dessert.  The matcha-flavored desserts don't taste at all like matcha.  The service is not too pleasant.  The waitress that is there in the afternoons is rather lazy and whines about work in a loud, clearly audible voice even when customers are dining.

A84FqRWy-bAMEpk5kUuuvA.text: Service: fantastic! We were greeted very warmly despite walking in for lunch just an hour before they close. Staff was very patient and attentive.  Ambience: beautiful decor. Nothing fancy but it's nice and cozy.  Food: Delicious! We started with garlic edamame and gyoza's. The edamame was very good but the gyozas could have been a little more flavorful. We then moved to the salmon and mackerel combo entrees. Each combo served with salad, soup and rice. Both dishes were very good and we especially enjoyed the salad - ginger dressing was spot on. We had also ordered the California roll, which sadly never made it to our table. Not sure if the server forgot to put in the order or what... anyways, we didn't really care (even though we were charged) because everything else was so great. It was likely just a small human error- no biggie!

OvuMLlunOAFONz6SGO_Uww.text: Delicious sushi, wonderful bento boxes, pleasant decor and courteous service. This is a  great choice for lunch and the specials are well thought out and filling. Japanese food done really well in a small out of the way "hole in the wall" restaurant. I drove by it so many times, but now I know what thay are all about. Give them a try, simply delicious!

ISGU7gJVZC05liIMu-8Yxg.text: The $5 ramen during HH on particular days is a meh.   Koro koro steak (rib eye steak) was delicious and I loved it.   The Teppan ramen had zero broth and way less flavor than usual this time around. Boooooooo.  A word of advice on the mentaiko yaki onigiri- as soon as you get it, open up in half so that the inside doesn't cook through from the internal heat. The mentaiko is good raw, but when it gets cooked it is NOT good at all. I made the mistake of waiting 10 minutes to eat it and wish I had managed to keep it raw inside otherwise there's no point in getting it.  Service is stellar as always.

TUFvqjs_16wyKskyXQ4BrQ.text: This place has a great late night happy hour. And the regular menu is good, too. Two favorites are the Ika butter and the grilled lamb chop.  Definitely one of my favorite spots for late night eating. Good service, too.

M3hcN6-hQUxKKGcoekmcAw.text: I love this place! Everything here is so irresistible and honestly nothing beats a tapas style menu. It is so much fun to try 3-5 different items everytime I come here and I never leave disappointed.  My all time favorites here are the Hamachi Kama, Koro Koro steak, and Age Dashi Tofu. The desserts are great too.   It also makes the restaurant feel super authentic when the customers all around you are speaking in Japanese, I think that even all the waiters here are fluent as they take orders in Japanese as well!   I used to go to Ichiza whenever I wanted that Izakaya adventure but Kyara beats that with a way better menu design and more often than not, better tasting food (just missing that honey toast).  You just HAVE to try this place! Also adding some menu pics since I didn't see any pics on yelp of their current menu - 07/2017

2MHUqNrkz37UGO5771tzEw.text: Had tapas there one evening after work which inspired me to try one of their lunch specials the next day -- excellent miso grilled salmon.  Domo Arregato !  Re: tapas,  had asparagus wrapped in bacon -- tasty snack and simple skewered presentation.  Only, I prepare my bacon more grilled and slightly crispy.

3n_pRWmcsg6mXqYXy4kmzA.text: Best place especially lunch. Food are good, a lot of choices. Every person working here is friendly.

KlsF-wjtg6oXZi7dUHQmmw.text: Kyara is a very good place to drink and dine.  I've eaten so many thing here, but what stands out for me are the takoyaki, asparagus bacon, tori kara age, koro koro steak, and spicy tuna bowl.  Kyara is especially good when happy hour rolls around as Kirin pitches are $10 and large house sake is $3.50.  Fair warning, this place really picks up right as soon as happy hour starts at 10pm.    I can honestly say that I have not eaten a bad dish here.  Everything that I've eaten was good or great.  Service is always good.  The staff is friendly, attentive and accommodating.  Food also comes out pretty quick, so there is never a long wait to eat.  I used to like Ichiza, but this place is much much better.

33u9BPt4FvgG4GVkTtUNoQ.text: Been here three times now. We've always sat at the bar.  I can never go wrong ordering the salmon ikuradon (5/5) but decided to try something new last night.   Takoyaki 6 pcs- my go-to app. I like that they use aonori plus the outside is crispy and inside is not mushy.  Black Pork belly skewer with salt- this was the favorite of the night. Perfectly seasoned and not overcooked, very succulent, didn't need anything else.  Koro Koro steak- got this since it had so many good reviews; normally I'd get my usual salmon ikuradon. Now I don't  if what we had last night was how it was supposed to taste but that thing was super biiiiitter. Maybe they cooked it too long cause the sauce near the edges took on a black charred color. I ate it with rice but I dipped some of the meat in soy sauce to rid the bitterness..  Teppan ramen- bf's choice. DON'T GET THIS. It was completely devoid of any flavor whatsoever. It just tasted like Ramen noodles sauteed in butter and they didn't bother to season with any salt OR pepper. Chow mein from panda has more flavor lol I had to sprinkle pepper on myself but there was no salt on the table, only soy sauce. There were more noodles than meat and veggies too.  Service is always good, they keep the refills coming before you're out.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. New promotion!

Mo1AopW5zTL99TeFb3XirA.text: The menu has changed over time for the better.  Mostly go for the lunch menu, plenty of choices, and the food is delicious.  Only problem i have is with the service, seems to be a little haphazard.  Last time I went, I ordered a lunch combo, and they brought the rice, soup, salad, and tempura first, then the entree (pork katsu) was supposed to be brought out immediately after that.  However, the entree never came until I called the waitress over and asked what happened.  Seems they forgot or had the order messed up, so I had to take home the katsu since I had finished  eating everything else.  Sensed confusion in the whole operation, like waitress takes your order, then it is brought out by someone else, but seems Kyara needs better coordination if they are going to do something like that.  Cheesecake Factory and California Pizza kitchen has that kind of service down to a "T", so Kyara has a ways to go to meet that kind of standard.

Z3VFsulvL1xyVrAaN-WNgw.text: My wife has heard amazing things about this place from a friend, so I went there for lunch with a business partner one day.  We got nigiri and a few rolls -- a couple of the pieces of fish weren't super fresh and the rolls were only middle of the road. Maybe its just the lunch service was busy, but I'm glad I didn't take my wife as it would have been quite the disappointment.

rMKzqgmLntvXndU1gcFUnQ.text: 3 of us came around 12:30AM, ate and drank for about an hour and asked for a check around 1:30AM. While dining at Kyara, we saw employees drinking with guests. We asked one of the guy with white turtle neck for our check. First check he brought to us was a wrong one and he seemed little drunk at the same time. We told the guy that it wasn't our check. We didn't hear any sorry from the  guy but he told us we were very nice of us to tell him that it wasn't out check. While he was talking, I was able to tell that he was a bit drunk. Then he went back to the counter and brought us a second check. Second check was a wrong one too. Then, I quickly asked for the manager since I thought they were playing with us. We asked our server for the manager and she pointed out to the white turtle neck guy. I told him this isn't funny anymore. It took about a min to bring our real check and told us he wasn't tried to be funny. I do understand people make mistakes but when you were having fun with other guests and drink while on the job then bring out two wrong checks is not right. I was very disappointed at Kyara and this will be my last time visiting this place.

eTeAor9JfGpXgeUM0bDgpA.text: Japanese village vibes can't save the poor service ~  I enjoy the atmosphere because it's tiny and there are a few small rooms with tight seating. I'd imagine it's close what you'd experience in Japan.   Lunch options are a tad on the higher priced side but you get an extremely large amount of food which doesn't really match the atmosphere with everything being so small. Bento boxes come with a chicken, fish or beef and you get rice, side salad, tempura shrimp and veggies, and miso soup. Far too much food for lunch. The food is decent and my teriyaki salmon was very good. Other favorites are the salad with a ginger dressing and the tempura.   So now we get to the service. For starters it's extremely slow. It takes far too long to get your order in and then you wait a long time to get your food. They also don't come around once they've given you your food so you're always thirsty waiting to get anyone's attention. Everything comes out first except your protein so your rice gets cold before you get the rest of your meal. Weird. This has happened twice to our group so we'll need to take it off the list for lunch options as we don't always have 2 hours for leisurely breaks. Maybe dinner is more organized?

x8rdX3tKL96UrC9dMccohg.text: I've been coming here for a few years, and holy crap, service has gone down. Went here with 4 other people at 10pm last night, and getting from just getting water, all the way to getting our checks just took FOREVER. The foods still decent, however, they take forever with everything. They barely come back to check on us, and when they do, they literally check on one table, then just walk away! They took 10 minutes just to get us water, 25 minutes for the food, and our last 25 minutes there was from trying to get the bill. Took them forever to come to us for us to ask for the bill, and about 5 minutes for them to swipe our cards. We got there at 10pm, and we left at 11:30... we were literally the only table in the area for our first 30 minutes there... I don't even know if I want to come back unless I have absolutely NOTHING planned for the rest of the day.

taA0-yke3i_dC6aMhw-UAQ.text: My favorite HH place!!! Am here at least 3 times a month with my bf probably because work late at night too. Our usual order are the intestines, onion salad, Caesar salad and salmon sashimi bowl. We order the sashimi dinner as well and the fish is on pointtt. This place is perfect for us who works late at night and just wanna a quick beer to ease the stress from working hahaha. Kyara is def on our top list of most visited restaurants. Oh and the staff is amazing too!

ly-ZEYEcaUvlvHbfAFTpTg.text: This is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas , they need more recognition  for their amazing food and employees - by far phenomenal! My wife and I really enjoyed the atmosphere, the service  is very friendly and fast. The servers are what make everything so much better , our server who I believe was the manger , Brian , was very assertive and made our night with his personality. Not only was he good to us , we saw how he treated the other tables of people around us and we were in shock of how good he was , too good to be True! I would hire him at my restaurant any day! We will for sure be back to Kyara ! Thank you so much for the great service

GLWwJ_BMpfIPy8sVt-oLkg.text: This is the spot for a late night Japanese happy hour. $12 for a pitcher gives you about 4 pours so it is equal to the $3 per glass they have as well. Takoyaki and Ika Butter tasted great. The service was outstanding from the moment I walked in at 11 at night! Definitely will keep this place in mind while I'm out late.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

6t9dZUNqlom02O3wy__Uow.text: Still our favorite Japanese restaurant in town! The menu is always changing, prices are still great, and always a good vibe ! Highly highly recommended !!!

VDiLpy7OEhZedGuriZqp2Q.text: I love izakayas! I love that there's so many in the valley. I've been here a few times and have had pretty good experiences. We came in and ordered a bunch of skewers, chawan mushi, a shrimp appetizer, corn on a stick and an ikura bowl.  The skewers always come out amazing, I personally like the ones that are seasoned with salt (you can choose when you write it down on the paper). My favorite so far is the pork cheek. The texture is just amazing, it's like a melt in your mouth goodness but still has a slightly chewy texture to it. Unfortunately they forgot to make a handful of the skewers that we ordered but they fixed it right away.   The corn was on their specials menu - it's like grilled corn on the cob brushed with a slightly sweet teriyaki like sauce. My wife was a huge fan, I personally don't care for corn on the cob (mainly because I'm too lazy to eat it and it gets stuck in my teeth) but I'm glad she enjoyed it.   The chawan mushi was typical, the small fried shrimps appetizer is something we always order. They fry them in butter until crispy - the shells turn out so crispy that you could just eat it whole with no problem. Ikura bowl was nothing special (except that it IS one of the best things in the world in its own natural state) but the portion was generous.   By the way, the free appetizer with Yelp check in is actually only good for an ice cream dessert. Or at least this was what I was told the last two visits. You may want to ask about it first should you choose to use it.

6v529vEpzC9c8SJU0ZfyVQ.text: This is probably my favorite izakaya restaurant in town. The skewers are delicious and fairly priced, the sashimi platter is very fresh. There is always something new delicious and exciting to try on the menu.

QBESyELi3rDjOC_pLPeDhw.text: Went here for some late night food.  Environment: I actually really like their set up, it really reminds me of Japan. They play Japanese music, the seatings are mostly small tables or at the bar. This place is not very big, but it is very personable. It is also very calm environment, not super loud or bar like, although their drinks are good.   Service: the waiters are most likely from Japan, their English is not super good, but they do understand enough to order food. I also kind of like it because it seems more authentic.  Food and drink: their sake is good, and I'm a huge fan of Japanese beer so really enjoyed the Kirin draft. As for food, very authentic and very delicious. I saw how they cooked their skewers, and again it brought me back to Japan. Their sushi was good, the skewers were tasty, the oysters were amazing and the price for everything was not bad. I also have to mention that the food comes out slowly, but it is great when you are socializing with friends and the food comes out individually.   I really enjoyed this restaurant, I believe that it is a great late night spot for food and drinks.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

l5yX7KjTYHha_GtIQmvdxQ.text: Very disappointed. Their menu offer. Sapporo pitcher for happy hour $12. I ordered a pitcher to a server and was replied that the order was out. So I asked a pitcher of Asahi for the same price since Sapporo was out. She asked the shift manager and replied to me that they will charge the Asahi for higher price. This is absolutely lack of customer's satisfaction response. As I finished my foods I was a crocroach ran away 3 feet from where I am sitting. I will not going back again.

Q4h5CYc4F5rroI1qHYeNcA.text: After a late visit to the Grand Canyon, we needed something open late and we were missing some asian flavours so this izakaya called our name. With a restaurant reminiscent of classic japanese, the food was also authentic and tasty. Again, quite pricey but what do you expect on the strip. Large menu variety and well made food.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zrTr4XJ2dJkJUpxjVjUW1A.text: Sorely disappointed in this place. I had this place bookmarked ever since moving to Vegas nine months ago. We were in the area and my friend recommended we go here so I figured I could unbookmark it from my list. We ordered the salmon tartar, agedashi tofu, sausage, chicken tender skewers, chicken and green onion skewers, enoki mushrooms wrapped in bacon skewers, pork belly skewers, and grilled mackerel--all of which were very disappointing. The skewers all tasted of char. I could taste the grill and that was it. The chicken meat was dry. The kitchen used the same teriyaki sauce for all the skewers and was quite stingy with it. I couldn't even moisten my dry meat with anything besides force feeding myself and washing it down with green tea. The grilled mackerel was tough and dry as well.   Be sure to double check your receipt when they bring you the check. It's easy to lose track of what you ordered since small plates can easily add up. A neat trick is to count the number of plates you ordered instead of remembering the names of the plates. I'm glad I did because they tried to charge us for alcohol that we didn't order. After correcting the mistake, we asked the lady to split the bill down the middle with two cards. She couldn't even do that! Our server overcharged me! So that was her tip. She either really wanted the extra couple bucks or was just having a rough night. Sorry, but I won't be returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken tender skewers
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enoki bacon skewers
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled mackerel

ligxVz8ZfJKOFWTSR8D5zQ.text: Food is average but Im reviewing after sitting here for almost two hours and still waiting on food. Our server is nowhere to be seen and there's another server next to our table simply standing and drinking with a table. Unprofessional and absolutely no sense of urgency. We had simple orders of grilled meats which take no longer than 10 minutes to cook. No idea what's going on here. Would not come back again.

JQOFo06o8CYOH7L3pdzBbw.text: It's a slow wait for your food to come out. Don't come if you are hungry. Happy hour from 10pm-2am.. they gave us the happy hour menu 10 min after we ordered more food and another pitcher... and we had informed them that it was our first time here... after getting the happy hour items before the regular priced menu we told them we ordered the regular price stuff before this other stuff came out and we were full... they looked confused and we were upset because seriously if you want people to come back give them good advice and good food-- you are already fat from the strip... u was not happy about that expectation of service. The food is good, happy hour is good. But the staff put us in the back and the restaurant was empty, you would think they would be more hospitable, the restaurant is huge ... disappointed to say the least.

AVX7E7Rj607CACJavAjsMQ.text: My girlfriend and I frequently attend here. The one thing that's nice is that everything is reasonably priced because you're not ordering huge portions. Shrimp butter rice and some of the skewers are some of our favorites.

AdvgGx-o5gzyNoecTfk5dA.text: Please note that this review is based solely on customer service and NOT the food. I am unable to review the food for you because I never got the chance to try it. I had plenty of time, though, to smell how delicious it could have been.  We called on a Saturday night (tonight) at 9:12 pm and made a reservation for 9 people. We were informed that the table would be available approximately 20 minutes from the time of our call.  We arrived to the lobby at about 9:40 pm and were told that our table wasn't ready; it would be another 15 minutes.  The party of 2 finished eating and just needed to settle their bill so their table could be set up as part of our table. After waiting another 35 minutes, we asked how much longer it would be for our table to be ready. She told us it should just be 10 more minutes as the customers were finished eating and they were just waiting for them to leave.  At about 10:30 pm, she asked us if we wanted to get seated in the first table and wait for the second table to be available. I partly wanted to wait because I already invested so much of my time and the food smelled SO GOOD, but I also couldn't believe the lack of customer service. Please don't offer reservations if you are unable to honor them.

ihBvhFLyfL4JF8dPP0QzFA.text: It's hard to find good sushi restaurants in Vegas, so I'm incredibly thankful to have found Kyara! They have a variety of dishes including meat and veggie skewers and tasty fish.

EcnNATt6jcNtjicsf_lA-A.text: Such good food, especially their lunch special! And who doesn't love free edamame? Plus they have amazing service too. Can't wait to come back

Tec-pXRxGvs3NhDKvjVo_A.text: After midnight one of the better places to snack in Vegas.. Unique Shochu  choices, and probably the best robata in Vegas. Had bacon wrapped mochi perfectly executed, toasted till nutty, perfectly rendered a gooey. Fatty pork cheeks were great. Ankimo "torchon" was super fresh, o-toro was good quality, rice is lacking in texture but good. Super gracious staff, menu keeps getting bigger and better. Great neighborhood restaurant.

f7OlDKSmafr7OKPjAkEYoQ.text: I came here with a friend for a quick lunch. Their lunch hours are 11-330pm? anyways, its really easy to find - its right next to sambalatte.  They have an arrangement for lunch specials. They have individual sides or u can get boxes where it comes with rice, miso soup, tempura, and whatever main dish u ordered.   My friend had gotten a sushi roll. This wasn't on the lunch special menu. They don't have all the rolls they would have on the dinner menu, only a portion. The price they offer for the roll during lunch time however is the same as the dinner price.   The miso salmon is really good! They glaze the salmon with light miso sauce and the portion of the fish is good too. You can ask for brown rice instead of the white rice- no extra charge.  The only reason I gave four stars instead of five is because they didn't have curry katsu. They had Japanese curry rice as an option and katsu as an option- but not together. I thought it was odd that a Japanese place didn't have the combination of both. I'm not sure if the dinner has it or not, but the lunch menu sure didn't. And if you wanted it, you have to order BOTH dishes so you would end up getting charged basically double. Booooo

2Lv7DjtrmSNsa5AipvxvhA.text: It took a few visits, but once Kyara grew on me, it's become a favorite! Every time I eat here I try something new that I really enjoy. Which is more than I can say about that other place that starts with an "I." In-N-Out? Island Style? Anyways. Point is, it's rare to visit a place multiple times and discover a great dish during each visit. So what are the hits at Kyara? Curry rice with Chicken Katsu (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...): This is one of the lunch specials, and makes me wish I worked nearby! The curry has a great balance of heat and flavor, while the katsu is lightly breaded and not burnt at all. Highly recommended if you're in the area. Garlic Chicken Ponzu (yelp.com/biz_photos/82YG...): At $5.80, this is a great portion for a tapas place if you ask me. Garlic is delicious, ponzu is delicious, put them together and it's double delicious. Aburi Shime Saba: Seared Mackerel with yuzu ponzu sauce. Mmm mmm good! You get a good serving of mackerel with this dish. It's also very lightly seared. Like maybe the chef prepared the dish within view of a flame; that lightly seared. Tsukune: Ground Chicken and pork skewer. Tasty and freshly prepared. A bit crisp on the outside with a hot and juicy interior. Service here has been consistently good, along with food quality. If you're headed to Kyara, be sure to invite me along!

ju96N_pp-xi7r3oDMg7L1w.text: Disclaimer: Review is for Lunch only.  Came here for lunch w/ my team and had the Deluxe Bento.  For $12.95, it was a good steal as it came with Shrimp tempura, Vegetable tempura, 5 pieces of Sashimi (2 salmon, 3 tuna), California Roll and Chicken Teriyaki!    Everything tasted fresh and good to taste.  I wouldn't mind coming back for lunch!  My team also enjoyed it!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All the options that come with your lunch combo!

HMzYgAOhVAH4pTuw2MMgug.text: Worst 60.00 I've ever spent.   Ridiculous wait time for food. 30 mins wait for deep fried oysters?!   Mediocre food, over priced  Incorrect order  Incorrect bill  Fatty Koro Koro steak.   Fried oysters and Koro Koro steak not eaten at all!   First and last time!

4WwykI0c65kSUFfFysF7bQ.text: It is long overdue that I write an outstanding review for this restaurant. This spot is definitely in my top five to hit up on a regular basis.   Over a long period of time coming here, I have never received less than outstanding service across the board. I'm always greeted very kindly and thanked. Service with a smile at all times. They are knowledgeable about all of their items including spirits.   Then of course there is the fantastic food. I'm vegetarian and their options to meet my needs are never disappointing. I definitely recommend the gobo chips, agadashi tofu, garlic butter edamame, and shitake mushrooms. Everything is fairly priced.   They have a happy hour that starts at 10 pm as well, so I always have a good serving of hot sake for 3 bucks a pop.  Thanks Kyara!

AOJcn5W5S18pYnie4MSxUg.text: Best izakaya in Vegas! Good beer, fresh fish, and great tapas. Service is always great. Staff always comes by and asks how everything is going. This place always has a wait but I think it is well worth the wait. Ask for daily specials because they have uni, toro, etc! Happy hour (starts at 10 or 11pm?) is also a good idea if you are coming in to consume a lot of alcohol!!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yellowtail w/ jalapenos

krxbGCa7Y5FYSQdIEvsZOA.text: First I love this place cause of the quality of food and how close it is to my place. They're known for tapas. I love their fish. Kokoro beef. Beef tongue. Grilled squid and the list goes on. Last but not least is their green tea waffle with vanilla ice cream and strawberry puree   This place is pretty small, so it's smart to call ahead and put a reservation. Happy eating

h4y0ZqnlNcjxcsm54xWNDw.text: Came back for dinner. Lunch is a far better value, but there are a lot of great things to be said for their izakaya-style dishes!   From living in Japan, I think the way you are supposed to order at an izakaya is little by little, and ordering things as snacks to accompany drinking. However, I did not follow this method and ordered tapas-style. We ordered a ton and got super stuffed.  I loved the skewers--I got a bunch of different kinds. The vegetable kushi skewers were actually the best, which I was super surprised about. Get the okra, asparagus and the onion. Onion was best!   We tried the miso cheese, which was kind of weird. It is basically miso infused cream cheese. My boyfriend loved it though.  Chawanmushi was okay, a little much since it arrived at the end of the meal. It was very salty.  My boyfriend ordered the fish of the day...all I remember about it was it didn't taste very good and it was pretty darn expensive for the size (around $15, I'd say)?  Staff was a little inattentive, which I was sad about. They seated all of the people who came in in the front section (I came around 5:30 p.m., which is super early). I would have rather sat in the side area with a view of the sushi bar, so I will ask for that next time.

gQNSgOlg9XuvXXvHhEZRsA.text: Came here for lunch the other day and was fully satisfied with my meal. For about $10 I ordered the spicy  tuna rice bowl, and for the combination it came with a bowl of miso soup, a salad, and a variety of tempura. Everything was pretty much on point-- the soup was flavorful and had a balanced saltiness, the salad came with a sweet ginger dressing on the side which was a nice touch, and the tempura was fresh and crispy. I especially liked that there was kabocha (Japanese pumpkin) tempura along with sweet potato and asparagus. The spicy tuna itself was pretty good, however there was a bit of sweetness to it which was a bit strange for my taste. My dad ordered sashimi in the combination meal and he said that the fish was fresh.  Overall I was pleasantly full, and it was a great deal for the price. Service was good as well, as someone was always there to refill my cup of tea. I definitely want to come back again for lunch and for dinner as well!  -------------------------------------------- Update: Came back here for dinner for the first time and it was even better! Everything we ordered was delicious in its own way. Two dishes that stood out to me were the  agedashi nasu (like agetashi tofu but with eggplant), and the Roppongi sushi roll. The Roppongi roll was kind of a surprise because it was described as "spicy tuna roll with tuna on top" on the menu but had an amazing sauce-- I think were was sesame and probably mayo. The fish was fresh and the service was as good as the other times-- plates were cleared up quickly and all the servers were friendly.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon onigiri
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon ikura don
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. House roll? I think

rjnYSPI1pFM-pv_T5nDopA.text: I love this place. I give it 4.5 stars. I used to go to Ichiza back in the days, but it just went downhill and I was waiting for a decent Japanese tapas place. I totally forgot about this place and I'm glad I went again. We ordered tuna tataki. It wasn't great nor was it bad. Can I pass on this the next time I come here? I sure can. The garlic squid was an OMG moment for me.  The squid was melt in your mouth and the garlic sauce was delicious. The asparagus was good with the squid. Perfect combo. It was so good, I had to order another one.  Word of advise, save the garlic sauce so you can dip it with other stuff. Hehe we also ordered the asparagus Pork. It looked great, but I didn't try it, but at least I took a picture of it. The Cajun chicken was okay. It didn't distinguish from any other popcorn chicken I have had in other places. I thought it lacked a bit of seasoning, but what makes it Cajun is the sauce. The sauce wasn't a deal breaker either. We also ordered the soft shell crab. It's soft shell crab that you can get in most Japanese restaurants. It was good fried crab. Mmm. Jalapeno poppers were delicious. Not spicy at all and it has bacon bits on it. Again, great but not awesome. We ordered a variety of skewers, which didn't disappoint. We ordered gizzard, Pork cheek, Pork brisket, and chicken wings. Least favorite was the chicken wings on the skewer. Not much meat on it.  We also ordered the takoyaki. It's wheat flour ball with octopus. Nom nom. Be careful when you bite into it, it's piping hot and you really dont want to explain to other people that your mouth got burned by giant scorching balls. Lol we also ordered the ikura and salmon bowl and mini udon. Both were good and the udon broth was good after eating all that food. It makes your tummy nice and warm. But wait!! What better way to top an evening off? Ice cream!!! So we ordered the maccha waffle with vanilla ice cream. I'm not sure where I made room for this, but it was delicious. It reminded me of honey toast except honey toast on crack! Lol. Highly recommend to get this. I can't wait to come back and what's better, they are open late.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna tataki
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Garlic squid with asparagus
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Asparagus pork

Hm4eOS2KABIZAX9AMna2kw.text: Kyara is one of the more pleasant finds I've come across in Las Vegas. From the outside it's an unassuming location that happens to be right next door to a 24 hour smoothie shop. But step inside and once that door closes you feel like your in another world. Las Vegas just kinda fades away.   I tried Kyara for lunch and was seated where I could see right into the kitchen. There were tables located in semi-hidden areas along the North wall and also a larger table in a small room along the East wall. Service was 5 star + from start to finish. I had questions, they answered everything I asked and even helped me with my chopstick technique or serious lack thereof.   But this is a restaurant review and the food here shines. I had trouble deciding what to get so I ended up with a lunch combination plate. I ordered a spicy salmon bowl and it came with tempura, salad, miso soup and rice. While I enjoyed everything presented the tempura was a mixed experience with 2 pieces I was ho-hum with (still good though) and 3 pieces that just flat out wowed me. The sizes were smaller than expected but as this is a Japanese Tapas establishment I had adjusted my portion size expectations before coming in the door. The salmon bowl with a little bit of additional soy sauce was wonderful. The salad was very good, and the miso soup was excellent.   When one looks at the quality, the presentation, the decor, the service, and how good everything tastes giving Kyara 5 stars right off the bat for a first visit is very easy. It is ultra rare for me to be smiling all the way through my lunch and be excited by everything on my plate but Kyara did that for me. When the only negative thing I could find was that they needed to take a duster to one of the air vents (and it wasn't that bad), I knew I had found something special. And the fact that you can sit and look right into the kitchen and see your food being prepared, it eliminates any doubts about quality of the food or the skills of the preparers.  I will be back, and I will bring others. If you're reading Kyara's reviews and are debating on giving it a try, you need to get off the fence and go try it.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon bowl for lunch! Not what I expected!

vWLPZwtxe-olsjk1BHyMqA.text: If your looking for an authentic Japanese restaurant, this is the place to go. I will definitely dine here again. Food is authentically delicious, and service is a plus!

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carpaccio
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sashimi bowl
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tofu

cTvUyMcr_VIcy_djvSwa2Q.text: Despite the proximity to my house, this was my first visit to Kyara. It definitely took way too long. Finally after mentioning I wanted to try the place every time I drove past this place with my fella, he decided to surprise me with a visit here for Valentine's dinner last night.   We arrived around 8pm and were seated very quickly. Glad my fella made a reservation, as they had our table ready and waiting for us when we arrived at the busy restaurant. The server was quick to approach us for our drink orders and was extremely attentive and diligent throughout the meal. I have to give extra kudos for the impeccable service at Kyara. We were never left wanting for anything. Our drinks were always full, our stream of food arrived promptly and well spaced out and all the servers were incredibly friendly and helpful with recommendations.  We ordered a large variety of options to get a sampling of as many things as we could. My favorites for the evening were the jalapeno salmon, garlic potatoes (despite burning the entire inside of my mouth), bacon wrapped enoki mushrooms, tempura cheese with fig jam and the yuzu dessert, which was amazing. Everything else was pretty good as well, but it's hard not to compare the place to my other two favorite izakaya restaurants in town Raku and Ichiza. I loved a lot of the dishes, but the skewers and other cooked food didn't blow me away as much as Raku or Ichiza, unfortunately. Don't get me wrong, the food was definitely solid and I will definitely be back to try a smattering of other options. I just wish the char on many of the grilled and skewered meats was a little more present. The sasami with wasabi was overly dry and flavorless, so I don't think I'd order that again.  The fish, starch and dessert selections were amazing though. Very tasty indeed.  The fantastic service was topped off by the presentation of chocolates and a pink rose to commemorate the Valentine's holiday. Very nice touch.  I have heard very good things about their lunch offerings and look forward to hopefully trying the place out for lunch some time soon. Definitely a great option in my neighborhood. So glad they have a place close to home to satiate my cravings. I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sasami with wasabi mayonnaise.
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shishito pepper skewers
Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Butabara - Pork Belly (Tare/Shio)

A_zsoaJjuR5MpJMLHFrQNw.text: We tried the Tuna Salad which tasted like Ranch dressing. But the crunchy garlic strips on top were good and the Tuna seemed fresh.   Also had the spicy butter shrimp rice. Lots of good flavors there but I didn't like tomatoes in my fried rice.   Also tried the Lisa Lisa roll...that was my favorite. Good mix of textures and flavors.   Unfortunately the menu is mostly in Japanese making it difficult to understand .

ZHMw8B4XKXSvL5_xQRtmVA.text: This place probably would've been a disaster... We walked in and we're kind of tossed aside by the man who greeted us. He then quoted us a 30 minute wait (which obviously I understand) but when we began to wait longer, I asked if we could move one of the stools from the waiting area next to the empty stool at the bar and enjoy our dinner there. He said no and could not explain why.  Then, Angelica came and fixed everything. She apologized for our wait, took my suggestion about the stool, and brought us a comped orange juice for are trouble. She was great and changed our whole experience :)

UcMo_XH_HfwGvqEkjpguPg.text: I'm not sure how many stars I should give this restaurant.. The lunch special is awesome! Great food a very generous portion, however, they have the worst staff I have ever encountered. Very rude! I watch them discourage people from waiting daily. Calling a 5 to 10 min wait a 20-25 min wait and holding ghost reservations. The only reason I come back is because of the chef. In my opinion they would be much more successful with a new front staff.

photos.caption: Photo of Kyara Japanese Tapas - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy!

_3KkRBF_XszwuSB1Vkblwg.text: I love Japanese food ! But This restaurant going down.... Not good anymore ... They have too many server !!! But service is horrible and very very slow !!! We wait 20 min to get Abr tuna jalapeno on top. Food and drink is Over price ! Why I give 1  is inside restaurant and restroom are very clean. But service!! Very terrible !

vIHpZxKwMhyuLxu9XZd5GQ.text: I went to this restaurant as it was recommended for its katsu. I went there the same day to find out that the katsu is only available on their lunch menu. My roommate and I stayed as we had already built our appetites. I had a beef and spinach salad. It was delicious, and it was the first time I had a dish that incorporated cold beef. The garlic potatoes were crisp and hot but could have had more flavor. For tapas, this is a nice place. I would recommend the skewers :)   The negative aspects were that they expected reservations and the seating was cramped. Also, my roommate would have like to be warned that the shrimp would come with their heads and skins on. (they didn't offer a refund for that appetizer, even though we didn't touch it)

yf-9HVlEauaI8wHqwgAucA.text: Pros:  salmon belly rice bowl good quality, nice friendly honest service   Cons: warm inside on a hot day (broke a sweat), food generally just ok (frozen edamame, gyoza), tasteless tempura, fatty not high grade eel on tiger roll, limited menu  This place deserves 3.5 yelp stars, not 4.  It's ok, I might give it another try but probably not.  Izakaya is new and a more diverse menu with higher quality fish and noodles.

l5_EPKAxBf8Z6Gi1IH8LuQ.text: It was my second visit at kyara. Honestly, it wasnt good at first time but I saw good riviews after and went back. Well, skewers were just so-so. Its little bit disappointed comparing ichiza. But sushi roll and mini udon, greentea afogato dessert!!!!!!! were really good!  And the service was way better than ichiza. This is good place to go for simple meal not too heavy. I will come back ;)
